Title: Vaults
Description:
Burial Vaults are a popular product that addresses a healthy demand for this type of offering already sold by the service. 
The income stream these specific products will bring into the cemetery service will be reinvested back into the service for sustainability projects and offset losses of income over the next several years as remaining burial spaces are used up.
Islington Council is seeking to invite suitable expressions of interest from suppliers for 1617-0087 Vaults. ICCS (Islington and Camden Cemetery Services) have been providing these products for a number of years over several areas within Islington and St Pancras Cemeteries.  We are looking to extend our current provision to new areas within the main site as well as increasing on the existing areas. 
The current arrangement is expired and the Council seek to establish a multi-supplier framework agreement.

Title: Provision of Building Surveying and Mechanical & Electrical Advice
Description:
2.1	The Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency ("DVLA" or the "Authority") is an Executive Agency of the Department for Transport, based at 3 sites in the Swansea region, employing around 6,500 staff. The Agency's primary aims are to facilitate road safety and general law enforcement by maintaining accurate registers of drivers and vehicle keepers, and to collect Vehicle Excise Duty. 

2.2	In March 2005 DVLA entered a 20-year PFI contract with Telereal Trillium (TT) for the refurbishment of the estate and the provision of facilities management ("FM"). DVLA and TT have agreed that DVLA has the option to de-scope the Soft Services element from the contract from 31st March 2023 ("partial Termination").  The contract expires on 31st March 2025.  

2.3	A Facilities Management (FM) Futures programme was formed in 2019 within which the PFI Contract Expiry Team has the remit to deliver an effective contract expiry and transition from the current PFI contract.  The team comprises DVLA Estates Management, Commercial and 'project' personnel.  A business case was approved by the DVLA Executive team in January 2021 that supported procurement of technical advice to the programme.

2.4	The PFI contract expiry requires that all assets are returned to DVLA in good condition.  The expiry also means that it will be necessary to transition to a different operating model for the delivery of all FM services.  It is with both of these challenges that DVLA requires 'project' leadership and specialist technical advice to 

i.	Confirm the scope of assets to be returned and the efficacy of the asset register. 
ii.	Work with the results of a recent comprehensive asset condition survey.
iii.	Manage a 'survey on expiry' with commercial advisers in ensuring that the assets are returned in the requisite condition; and
iv.	To support the design of a new FM service delivery model and its implementation.

2.5	It is anticipated that project leadership/technical advice will be required in relation to projects related to the key asset types: - 

i.	Land & Buildings - Chartered Building Surveyor or applicable 
ii.	Plant & Equipment - Chartered Mechanical or Electrical Engineer or applicable

Contract value amended to incorporate variation

Title: Integrated Domestic Abuse and Substance Misuse Model (IDAS) - Procuring a Delivery Partner
Description: The Council is inviting interest from suitable organisations to become our Partner to co-develop and deliver a community based Integrated Domestic Abuse and Substance Misuse (IDAS) Model to include services for domestic abuse and substance misuse. This will include support, and capacity building, engagement, early intervention, prevention, recovery co-ordination, family and carer support, community recovery support, peer support, clinical treatment, retention; through care; after care; relapse prevention care; relapse prevention and training. It is expected that the service will also work collaboratively with the Council's Housing Advice and Information Team. The contract period is 5 years with 3 x 12 month optional extensions.

Title: Specialist ergonomic furniture/equipment solutions
Description:
The Care Quality Commission (CQC) is a non-departmental body established under the Health and Social Care Act 2008 and is the independent regulator of health and adult social care in England. Its purpose is to ensure that health and social care services provide people with safe, effective, compassionate, high-quality care and to encourage care services to improve.

In order to fulfil our legal responsibilities under the Health and Safety at Work Act 1974 and the Health & Safety (Display Screen Equipment) Regulations 2002 as amended, CQC has contracted an external supplier to provide specialist Ergonomic Equipment.

The requests for the provision of equipment is usually identified by an internal or external DSE assessment or an occupational health assessment in relation to health needs, disability or "out of the norm" physical profile of individual employees.

The equipment ranges from specialist desks and bespoke chairs to ergonomic mice & keyboards to assist with conditions such as repetitive strain, post- surgery support, musculoskeletal issues and support equipment for those on the dyslexia spectrum.

Duration of Contract will be initially 24 months with option to extend for 1 further period of 12 months.

Title: Torbay Adult Social Care Voluntary, Community and Social Enterprise Alliance
Description:
Torbay Council has a strong commitment to supporting Voluntary, Community and Social Enterprise (VCSE) sector groups to ensure local people are at the heart of our approach. We have also been seeking to encourage further development of our partnership by involving the VCSE sector in how we allocate funds to ensure monies are well used for the benefit local people. We are planning to set up an Alliance of VCSE groups to meet these aspirations. This will involve asking this Alliance to engage as widely as possible with the community to help us capture new and innovative ideas and be involved in the procurement process to allocate these funds. 

To ensure a fair and transparent process and the credibility of the Alliance the Seleciton of VCSE Partners us being undertaken in accordance with Torbay Council's Contract Procedures.

Due to the nature of the Alliance, in line with Procurement Policy Note 11/20 Reserving Below Threshold Contracts, participation in this tender process is reserved for Voluntary, Community and Social Enterprise (VCSE)sector organisations whose Location is within the non-metropolitan area of Torbay. Please refer to Part 1 Information and Specification for definitions of VCSE and Location.

Organisation Name: Department for Business, Energy & Industrial Strategy
Title: CS22517 - SBRI Social Ventures Support Package
Description:
The final date and time for the submission of bids is 2nd December 2022 at 14:00

DO NOT apply directly to the buyer.

All tender information MUST be submitted through the Jaggaer eSourcing Portal.

Brief Description of Requirement

The Healthy Ageing Challenge is seeking a bespoke package of support for a group of Social Enterprises for a 14-month period.
The Social Enterprises are awardees of a recent Healthy Ageing Social Ventures competition - (www.ukri.org/news/social-ventures-invited-to-apply-for-healthy-ageing-product-funding) run through the Small Business Research Initiative (SBRI) scheme. A total of 2.7m was awarded, and the Social Enterprises are due to start their projects in Jan-Feb 2023.

The purpose of the support UKRI are seeking through this tender exercise is to provide the greatest possible opportunity for those Social Enterprises to achieve their growth potential and therefore impact at scale.

Please ensure you review all attached information to ensure a full understanding of this requirement. All attachments can be found with the Supplier Attachments tab within the Jaggaer eSourcing Portal.

This contract will be awarded based on the evaluation criteria as set out in the ITQ document.

How to Apply

UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) will be using the Jaggaer eSourcing Portal for this procurement.

To register on the Jaggaer eSourcing portal please use the link https://beisgroup.ukp.app.jaggaer.com/ and follow the instructions to register as a supplier.

If you are already registered on the Jaggaer eSourcing Portal and wish to participate in this procurement, please use the link: https://beisgroup.ukp.app.jaggaer.com/.

Once you are logged into the system you will be able to locate the Procurement you wish to leave a bid on by clicking the ITTs Open to All Suppliers and searching for the reference number CS22517.
Attachments: CS22517 - UKRI Precedent Goods Services Contract (High value) UnLtd - Fully signed - Redacted.pdf
Additional Text:
DO NOT APPLY DIRECTLY TO BUYER

All submissions will be assessed in accordance with the Public Procurement Regulations that apply to this opportunity.

Responses must be received by the date and time in the tender documentation; responses received outside of the deadline or not sent via the Jaggaer eSourcing portal will not be accepted or considered by the Contracting Authority further for this opportunity, unless a system outage is experienced, to which the Contracting Authority will advise upon accordingly. Interested organisations should ensure that they allow a sufficiency of time, prior to the deadline to allow all sections to be completed in full and any attachments to be uploaded.

As a user of the Jaggaer eSourcing Portal you will have access to the Jaggaer messaging service which facilitates all messages sent to you and from you, as well as other messages and updates in relation to any specific tender event. Please note that any and all information secured outside of the messaging service, shall have no Legal Standing, merit or worth and should not be relied upon by any organisation submitting a tender response. 

Please note it is your organisations responsibility to access these messages on a regular basis to ensure you have sight of all relevant information applicable to this opportunity.

The Contracting Authority expressly reserves the right:

i.	not to award any contract as a result of the procurement process commenced by publication of this notice; and

ii.	to make whatever changes it may see fit to the content and structure of the procurement; and under no circumstances as part of your organisations participation in this opportunity, will the Contracting Authority be liable for any costs incurred by any organisation as a result. If the Contracting Authority decides to enter into a contract with any successful organisation(s), this does not mean that there is any guarantee of subsequent contracts being awarded. Any expenditure, work or effort undertaken prior to contract award is accordingly a matter solely for the commercial judgement of your organisation in doing so.

About UK Shared Business Services 

UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) brings a commercial attitude to the public sector; helping our contracting authorities to improve efficiency, generate savings and modernise.

Where UK SBS is not named as the Contracting Authority within the documentation, UK SBS will be acting as an agent on behalf of the Contracting Authority.

Our broad range of expert services is shared by our customers. This allows our customers the freedom to focus resources on core activities; innovating and transforming their own organisations.

For full details of our partner base please review the following link: http://www.uksbs.co.uk/services/procure/contracts/Pages/default.aspx

Notice Identifier: Contract to undertake Gypsy Traveller Accommodation Needs Assessment and site appraisal work
Title: Contract to undertake Gypsy Traveller Accommodation Needs Assessment and site appraisal work
Description:
The Study must provide a robust assessment to inform policy development in housing and planning and will also form an integral part of the evidence base to underpin individual Local Plans.  The assessment should set out clearly it's methodology and give a clear analysis of the accommodation needs for those that have a need to live in a caravan or houseboat whatever their race or origin.  It should include, but not restricted to, bargees, Romany Gypsies, Irish and Scottish Travellers, new-age travellers and travelling showmen. The assessment should be broken down into the following groups:
•	Gypsies & Travellers who currently meet the planning policy definition for Gypsies and Travellers 
•	Gypsies & Travellers who do not meet the planning policy definition.
•	Travelling Showmen 
•	Houseboat dwellers, including Bargee Travellers and others
The assessment must be undertaken so as to meet the requirements of national policy, including the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Planning Policy for traveller sites, August 2015; all relevant national guidance, including the draft guidance to local housing authorities on the periodical review of housing needs - caravans and houseboats, March 2016; and best practice or guidance, such as the publication by the National Bargee Travellers Association - 'Best practice guide for boat dweller accommodation needs assessments', March 2019.

Title: Design, Build & Installation of a Fully Accessible Disabled Toilet
Description:
National Museums Liverpool (NML) is seeking to appoint one contractor to design, build and install one fully accessible disabled toilet on the ground floor of the Dr Martin Luther King Jnr (MLK) Building, a Grade 1 listed building, which is prominent in its location on the North of Albert Dock at Hartley Quay, Salthouse Quay, Royal Albert Dock, Liverpool L3 4AX.

The contractor will be the Principal Designer and Principal Contractor for the works on site, and responsible for the coordination and management of the whole site and any sub-contractor teams.  Installation and handover to be completed by 15 February 2022.   

To express an interest and participate in this procurement, applicants must register on Multi-Quote (Elcom), National Museums Liverpool's e-tendering portal at the earliest opportunity by visiting https://suppliers.multiquote.com/Page/Login.aspx.

To participate in this tender, tenderers will be requested to log into Multi-Quote, download, complete and upload the completed tender documents by the closing date and time for return of tender submissions. 

Please note that for this particular tender opportunity, interested tenderers may also request to attend a site visit. Further details are provided in the tender documents.

If you require technical assistance using the Multi-Quote portal, please contact Multi-Quote Support by emailing: support@multiquote.com; or calling: 0151 482 9230 or 020 3920 8054 - Monday to Friday (9am to 5pm).

Title: SYFR Building Energy Management System - Multi Site
Description:
South Yorkshire Fire and Rescue (SYFR) is looking to implement and replace a current Trend based Building Management System. across its estate portfolio.

A new cloud based system is required at 19 sites utilising direct digital controls to drive efficient operations, increase occupant comfort and protect the services employees across its estate portfolio. The specification is based upon the Samba system as a guide for our requirements but other equivalent systems (or better) will be considered by SYFR.

A larger and more comprehensive Building Management System is required at Central Headquarters (CHQ), Fleet Workshops/Stores and the Brigade Training and Development Centre (TDC) to replace the current Trend based Building Management System.

The contract will be delivered in 2 phases with two separate (scalable) solutions being requested.

Title: Flexi-job Apprenticeship Grant Fund
Description:
Flexi-Job Apprenticeship Grant Fund

This award notice relates to grant funding to support the start-up, development or diversification costs of new flexi-job apprenticeship agencies, or existing Apprenticeship Training Agencies (ATAs) who wish to become a flexi-job apprenticeship agency.

Funding will:
- support the start-up, development or diversification of flexi-job apprenticeship agencies allowing employers of all sizes to benefit from high-quality apprenticeships that are relevant and responsive to their skills needs and economic priorities.
- allow organisations to overcome barriers to the use of apprenticeships in their sectors caused by non-traditional and project-based employment models.
- increase starts in sectors where non-traditional and project-based employment models have made it harder for employers to engage with apprenticeships.
- drive quality experiences for apprentices, with corresponding improved achievement rates, resulting in positive outcomes for apprentices in terms of onward destinations in employment and training.
- support the progression of apprentices into sustainable employment or self-employment (mirroring the norm for their sector or profession)
Region: North East,North West,Yorkshire and The Humber,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,London,South East,South West
Contact Address 1: Education and Skills Funding Agency, Cheylesmore House South, Quinton Road

Title: Economic Consultancy for Liverpool City Region (LCR) Science & Innovation Audit Refresh & Asset-Based Innovation Cluster Development
Description:
The overall purpose of this brief is to engage suitable consultants to provide an evidence-based assessment of what is needed to achieve 5% of GVA invested in R&D in the Liverpool City Region (LCR) by 2030, and fulfil the following ancillary purposes:
(a) Refresh and update the 2017 LCR+ SIA, assessing and evidencing, new areas of opportunity, be that within the existing 3 priority areas or emerging world-class competitive strengths, taking account of all major subsequent strategic/policy and practical/project achievements and developments, national and local, not least re. net zero carbon.
(b) Review the LCR's live and pipeline innovation project portfolio, identifying any gaps/new potential projects in view of the SIA refresh process.
(c) Translate the outline asset-based innovation cluster development work into an actionable programme.
(d) Add value to the ongoing CA-led innovation/R&D economic benefit modelling work.
(e) Support efforts to provide a pioneering, evidence-based, economic case to UK Government for a place-based "innovation deal""
(f) Feed into all elements of the associated comprehensive innovation comms programme currently being developed.
(g) Inform the CA-led LCR Plan for Prosperity and all other key forward LCR innovation and wider economic development strategies, policies, and action plans.
(h) Inform the forward individual organisational aims and strategies of other LCR innovation ecosystem stakeholders, both local land external.
(i) Inform efforts to secure public and private investment for individual projects and other investment proposals by all LCR stakeholders.

Title: Traffic Signals and Ancillary Equipment Maintenance 2022
Description:
Somerset County Council is looking to establish a Traffic Signals and Ancillary Equipment Maintenance Term Service Contract for Works to be conducted across the Authority's Highways network.

The form of contract will be the NEC3 April 2013 edition Term Service Contract 'TSC'

The Traffic Signals and Ancillary Equipment Maintenance Term Service Contract will cover the maintenance of the authorities traffic signal and associated equipment including replacement of equipment:

• Installation of new traffic signal-controlled junctions;
• Modification and refurbishment of existing traffic signal-controlled junctions/Pedestrian crossings/Communications & VAS/VMS;
• Commissioning of new, modified and refurbished traffic signal-controlled junctions;
• Cyclic maintenance activities, vegetation removal etc.
• Traffic management associated with the above activities; and
• Perform the role of Designer when appointed by the Service Manager.

The estimated spend per annum through the Contract is expected to be in the region of £250,000 to £350,000 for Routine Maintenance and an estimated £150,000 for Non-Routine Maintenance.

The duration of the Contract will be an initial term of 72 months (6 years) with two extension periods of 24 months (2 years) each. The total duration of the contract including extension options will be 120 months (10 years). The exercise of the extension options will be at the discretion of the Authority, dependent upon, amongst other matters, satisfactory supplier performance.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Siemens Mobility Limited|24 Eversholt Street, London, NW1 1AD|NONE||No|No]

Title: PS21220 - Consultation study on UK science and commercial users' requirements for an Atlantic Constellation of Satellites
Description:
The final date and time for the submission of bids is Wednesday, 15 December 2021 - 11:00

DO NOT apply directly to the buyer. All tender information MUST be submitted through the Delta eSourcing Portal.

Brief Description of Requirement

The overall aim of the exercise is to inform BEIS decision making regarding the Atlantic Constellation.
The results of the consultation shall include:
•	A summary of possible UK use cases for an Atlantic Constellation, including climate science, coastal applications, and oceanography, as well as commercial opportunities to create downstream services;
•	Analysis of gaps in present data/information sources available to the UK, which an Atlantic Constellation might fill;
•	A brief analysis and recommended UK response to the current preliminary definition and requirements documents produced by the AIR Association (attached);
•	Suggested technical innovation opportunities for the UK arising from new instrumentation, algorithms, models, etc.;
•	A summary of UK industrial and other business opportunities arising through engagement in implementation of the system; and
•	Considerations of potential interest to BEIS and other UK government departments and agencies, including UKSA, Innovate UK and the Research Councils.

All attachments can be found with the Document Uploads tab within the
Delta eSourcing Portal. This contract will be awarded based on the evaluation criteria set
out in the ITQ document. How to Apply UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS)
will be using the Delta eSourcing Portal for this procurement. To register on the Delta eSourcing portal please use the link https://uksbs.delta-esourcing.com and follow the instructions to register. If you are already registered on the Delta eSourcing Portal and wish to participate in this procurement, please use the link: https://uksbs.deltaesourcing.com and the follow the instructions to 'Login' Once you are logged into the
system you will be able to link yourself into this procurement using the Access Code:
55265Q2QXU

If the contracting authority decides to enter into a contract with the successful supplier, this does not mean that there is any guarantee of subsequent contracts being awarded. Title: Design Team for the refurbishment of Stephenson Memorial Hall
Description:
Chesterfield Borough Council (CBC) is seeking to contract an experienced architect led multi-disciplinary team to progress the technical design of the refurbishment of the Stephenson Memorial Hall, Corporation Street, Chesterfield.
The Lead designer and consultants will be required to take the existing Stage 3 package of design work for the Stephenson Memorial Hall project from RIBA Work Stage 4 to RIBA Work Stage 6. 
Chesterfield Borough Council owns and manages the Stephenson Memorial Hall. One part of the building is currently used as the Pomegranate Theatre and the other part as Chesterfield Museum.
The re-design of the building to RIBA Stage 3 combines the museum and theatre uses to enable the building to be seen as an integrated cultural venue in the town and extend the life of an important heritage asset.
The refurbishment must be complete by November 2024

Title: Consumer Attitudes to Food Sold Online
Description: The objective of the Achieving Business Compliance (ABC)programme is to ensure that the regulatory system  keeps  pace  with changes  in the  food  system. This  is  through designing  a  responsive  regulatory  approach  that makes  the  best  use  of  technology, data,  relationships   and   innovative   methods,   to   ensure   that   food   is   safe   for consumers. The  program meals places  an  emphasis  on  working  with  businesses, local   authorities   and   other   partners   to   achieve   this   aim. Some   elements   of the programme  will  be  looking  to understand  the  way  in  which  online  businesses operate, identify  opportunities toadd  assurance and  work together   to   raise compliance using a range of activities including new data services and standardised operating  models.  To  make  sure  that  we  focus  our  activities  in  areas  of  the  food business  landscape  that  is  most impactful we wish  to  understand  the  way  in  which consumers chose to purchase food online, their appetite for risk and what influences their  purchasing  decisions. This research  and  understanding will  inform  both  our policy making and engagement activities and will allow us to define and develop new regulatory approaches.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Ipsos MORI|3 Thomas More Square, London, Greater London, E1W 1YW, UNITED KINGDOM|NONE_OTHER||No|No]

Organisation Name: Cumbria Constabulary - Office of the Police & Crime Commissioner
Title: Custody Based Healthcare to Detained Persons across Cumbria
Description:
Custody Healthcare Services operate within all custody suites and provides a clinical assessment of a detainees fitness for detention, interview, charge or supports an exit release risk assessment as required/requested by the police. The services also provide support to the forensic process carrying out activities such as taking samples for evidence purposes.
The service provides detainees with access to competent, qualified, and trained Healthcare Professionals (HCP's) and Advanced Practitioners on a 24/7 basis.
The Commissioner on behalf of Cumbria Constabulary is seeking tender bids from suitable suppliers for the provision of custody healthcare services.  Only those suppliers whose tender submission can cater for all of the requirements detailed in the Statement of Requirements will be considered. The competition process is based on the Light Touch Regime, modelled and underpinned on the Open Procedure. The contract duration would be an initial period of 5 years from 1st April 2022 to 31st March 2027 with options to extend for further periods up to 31st March 2032 It should be noted that the Commissioner will be conducting the tender via the "Bluelight e tendering portal" and prospective tenderers are advised to register at www.bluelight.gov.uk after which these documents can be downloaded, please note that no communication will be made outside of the system.

Title: Post Office Bulk Fuels (CCS Framework RM6177) - Norwich
Description:
Post Office Limited ('POL') operate a Commercial Fleet of in excess of 250no. Vehicles. Our Fleet obtain Fuels by means of Fuel Cards, making use of public forecourts.

However, POL have recently taken the decision to recommission on-site Fuel Bunkers at our Norwich facility as a means of providing contingency to any future interruptions to the supply of Fuel at forecourts.

There is zero committed spend against this call-off order. The estimated maximum total annual value is £38,302.00. However, this is based on a full year using on site tanks. For the avoidance of doubt tanks are to be used as a contingency only in the event of interruption to forecourt fuel supplies it is therefore likely that annualised spend will be significantly lower than the above estimate (Likely zero). Post Office have clearly communicated to the Supplier that we do not guarantee any maximum or minimum quantities against the proposed call-off order.

Title: Post Office Bulk Fuels (CCS Framework RM6177) - Newcastle
Description:
Post Office Limited ('POL') operate a Commercial Fleet of in excess of 250no. Vehicles. Our Fleet obtain Fuels by means of Fuel Cards, making use of public forecourts.
However, POL have recently taken the decision to recommission on-site Fuel Bunker at our Newcastle facility as a means of providing contingency to any future interruptions to the supply of Fuel at forecourts.

POL ran a further competition against the CCS Framework RM6177 (National Fuels 2) Lot 1 (against the appropriate regional sub-lot), for the supply of HVO (Hydrotreated Vegetable Oil) or Ultra Low Sulphur Diesel and shall be making use of the Call-Off Terms of that framework. 
This was in line with PCR 2015 running a further competition fairly and equally between suppliers giving them all the same chance to bid and used and weighted scoring criteria to assess their pricing responses. After this evaluation, we concluded that Watsons Fuels were the winning bidder and the contract was awarded to them. 

There is zero committed spend against this call-off order. The estimated maximum total annual value is £88,106.00. However, this is based on a full year using on site tanks. For the avoidance of doubt tanks are to be used as a contingency only in the event of interruption to forecourt fuel supplies it is therefore likely that annualised spend will be significantly lower than the above estimate (Likely zero). Post Office have clearly communicated to the Supplier that we do not guarantee any maximum or minimum quantities against the proposed call-off order.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Watson Fuels|Callow Park, Callow Hill, Brinkworth, Chippenham, Wiltshire, SN15 5FD|NONE||No|No]

Organisation Name: The Hillingdon Hospitals Nhs Foundation Trust
Title: Water Quality Phase 3 Works
Description:
This project seeks to improve the water quality in specific areas of the podium at risk of legionella and other water quality issues due to aging galvanized pipework breaking down due to age.

The creation of a new riser from the roof top water tanks, connection of the riser to the newly installed pipework and then to connect this to the podium existing system. Internally, targeted areas (as identified by the THH Water Quality Manager) will benefit from the replacement of old galvanised pipework with copper and the removal of dead legs.

This is the third phase of previous works to install new water supply infrastructure into the podium and enable connections of this network to existing podium pipework.

Title: BHCC HP Housing Adaptations Framework 2021  - AWARD
Description:
The Housing Adaptations Service of the Council  provides major adaptations works to individuals using the Council's Housing Adaptations Service (Service Users) (defined as those costing over ?1,000 excluding VAT) (the 'Works') including but not limited to:
      Access to garden 
      Access to house 
      Door widening 
      External rails 
      External structural work 
      Hard standings 
      Internal structural work 
      Kitchen adaptations 
      Level access showers    
      Over bath showers    
      Paths/ground works 
      Ramps      
      Wash and dry toilets
      Heating systems
      
      The focus of the Works under the Framework Agreement will be the provision of Works in Council owned properties. However, Works in private properties will be required as part of the Disabled Facilities Grant scheme.
      
      Works will be based on what has been recommended as necessary and appropriate for the disabled person by the Occupational Therapist (OT) and must also be considered necessary and appropriate in line with the Housing Grants, Construction and Regeneration Act 1996. Work may also be ordered under local discretionary DFG policies .
      
      The Framework Agreement will start in November 2021 and run for 3 years. There will be an option to extend for a further year at the Council's discretion.

Title: National Paediatric Diabetes Audit
Description:
The Healthcare Quality Improvement Partnership (HQIP) is seeking to commission an organisation that will support the delivery of the National Paediatric Diabetes Audit. The audit will be delivered nationally. The successful bidder will be required to build on the achievements of the audit to date and enhance the ability of the audit to be used for healthcare improvement.

The contract awarded will be for the duration of 3 years although there is an option to extend the contract to a further 2 years. Bidders are asked to submit their financial offer for the initial 3 years. It is anticipated that the new service will commence in May 2022.

This procurement is for clinical services which are part of the 'Public Contract Regulations (PCR2015)' for the purpose of the Regulations. The commissioner is not voluntary following any other part of the Regulations. The process will be similar to Open Procedure under the Regulations applies and so reserves the right to depart from that procedure at any point. The procedure that the Commissioner is following is set out in the Invitation to Tender.

Please note, there is no commitment by the Authority at this stage to include any of these. Taking the total of this aspirational intent into account, as well as the possibility that a contract extension may be offered for an additional two years, the potential ceiling value is £7,000,000 GBP excluding VAT.

To access the ITT documents:

For a bidder who has already registered themselves on WAX as a supplier:

Title: New Professional Midwifery Advocates (PMA) training
Description:
NHSE/I required a total of 5 suppliers to deliver a PMA Training Programme which includes bespoke training in Restorative Clinical Supervision (RCS) for up to 20 students each, to help ensure PMAs can provide effective RCS to the workforce during and after the pandemic.

Bidders can only bid for one cohort of 20 up to a maximum cost of £20,000, and the highest 5 scoring bidders will receive one cohort each only. Bids above £20,000 will be excluded.

The course offer should consist of a 10-day programme and be delivered virtually/remotely. It is a requirement that the start date of the course commences between the last week of February 2022 and the last week of March 2022.

NHSE/I shall be responsible for the recruitment and supply of applicants to the course. Providers will be paid the cost for a full cohort of 20 students regardless of the final number of students enrolled when the course commences.

Organisation Name: N E L COMMISSIONING SUPPORT UNIT
Title: Healthcare Services at Heathrow Immigration Removal Centres (IRCs)
Description:
NHS England and NHS Improvement (London Region) (hereafter referred to as "The Authority") invites Expressions of Interest (EoIs) and completed Invitation to Tender (ITT) submissions from all suitable providers for the delivery of  Healthcare Services in Heathrow Immigration Removal Centres (IRC). Healthcare services delivered at Heathrow Immigration Removal Centres are commissioned by the Health & Justice team, as part of NHSE/I London's Specialised Commissioning division.

Accommodation

The IRC Environment is constructed to be equivalent to Category B prisons. Healthcare services are delivered across the 2 sites Harmondsworth and Colnbrook, which are based near Heathrow Airport. 

Reception Criteria

•	Male and female adult residents. 
•	Detainees are subject to immigration restrictions.
•	The site hosts a wide range of nationalities- patient profile is subject to changes in line with Home Office activity.
•	Currently part of the IRC is being used a Short-Term Holding Facility for Calais Crossing arrivals. 

Scope of Services

The following services will need to be delivered through the contract commissioned through this procurement:
•	Emergency medical response - 365 days per annum. 24/7 on both sites
•	Reception healthcare screen - 365 days per annum. 24/7 on both sites
•	Primary care, including the provision of urgent care within the establishment and the management of long-term health conditions relevant for the adult population

•	Public health services
•	Sexual health services 
•	Allied healthcare services such as:

o	occupational therapy
o	physiotherapy
o	radiology
o	radiography
o	podiatry
o	dietetics

•	Optometry
•	Pharmacy and medicines management 
•	Mental health and trauma informed services 
•	Inpatient facilities 
•	Trauma Informed Care
•	Clinical substance misuse services 
•	Psychosocial interventions for substance misuse and mental health 
•	Healthcare administration and support services

Contract Length and value:

The contract for the Service will be awarded for a period of 5 years (60 months), with an optional extension for a further period of 2 years (24 months). Therefore, the maximum duration of this contract, if all extension options are taken up will be 7 years (84 months).

The maximum available annual contract value for this project is £5,800,000 per annum. 
Over the 7 years, if contract is extended to its full duration, the total maximum contract value will be £40,600,000. 
The annual payments will be subject to inflationary uplifts in line with published NHS national planning guidance.
Annual maximum contract value:  £5,800,000
Maximum Contract value for 5 years: £29,000,000
Maximum Contract value for 7 years = £40,600,000
Additional Text:
Bidders must refer to the procurement documentation for full detail about the Services to be delivered.

This procurement does not include Dental services which formed part of the procurement for Personal Dental Services in London prisons and the IRC (2020). The new contract for dental services started on 1 September 2021.

The Procurement process will be facilitated entirely online via ProContract portal. Interested Applicants wishing to participate in the procurement must register, express an interest and complete the online questionnaires hosted on the portal prior to the deadline for submission. All clarification requests and correspondence pertaining to this ITT opportunity must be directed through the portal. A timetable for the procurement, guidance re: process, and supplementary information relating to each contract opportunity is also available from the portal.

This Tender process is being managed by NEL Commissioning Support Unit (NEL) on behalf of The Authority in connection with a competitive procurement exercise that is being conducted in accordance with a process based on the Open Procedure under the Public Contract Regulations 2015 ("the Regulations" (as amended)). The services to which this Procurement relates fall within the "Light Touch Regime" (LTR) governing the procurement of Health, Social, Education and Other service contracts. Neither the reference to "Open Procedure", "ITT", "SQ", the use of the term "Tender process", nor any other indication shall be taken to mean that the Contracting Authority intends to hold itself bound to any of the Regulations, save those applicable to LTR provisions.

Bidders are also to note that information relating to this procurement is provided in good faith, and may be subject to amendment by The Authority.

Organisation Name: The Institute for Agriculture and Horticulture
Title: Integrated Digital Platform for CPD, Careers and Professional Membership
Description:
TIAH as the contracting authority required an economic operator to support all aspects of their development, launch and running of a membership and learning management system / online platform.

The platform that is developed must have the capability of providing all aspects of the authority's online experience for external users (visitors and members), internal users and partners. The platform must include a wide range of facilities including but not limited to a user profiling capability to deliver personalized experiences for platform visitors, managing and delivering digital learning, e-learning, blended learning, learning pathways, gamification, virtual instructor led training and instructor led training to users, with e-learning delivered directly by the authority and / or its training partners.

The platform must have the capability of being marketed on and offline using techniques including but not limited online advertising, social media marketing, and search engine optimization. It must be capable of supporting different commercial offers such as a range of pricing and subscription offers, memberships and potentially other commercial offers that may include bulk discounts and / or limited time offers.

IMPORTANT NOTE / HOW TO APPLY
TIAH is using the Mills & Reeve Collaborate portal to conduct the Procurement Process. The e-Tendering Portal can be accessed at https://dataroom.mills-reeve.com. Bidders can request access rights by contacting tiahprocurement@Mills-Reeve.com.

Organisation Name: Surrey And Borders Partnership Nhs Foundation Trust
Title: Education Leadership Programme
Description:
Leadership Programme:


•	SPFT (Sussex Partnership Foundation Trust) to purchase  500 individual licences for   the PM programme 
•	SPFT will be able to  allocate any number of people (up to 500)  at any time to complete the PM Programme during the   life of  the contract.
•	 Each licence will be valid for 12 months after enrolment and all  500 licenses will expire at the end of the 5 year contract.  Any licences initiated in the final year will therefore only be valid for the months remaining on the contract.
•	 The Supplier will create a sub account for SPFT and allocate 500 places on the programme.
•	Each licence will be activated as soon as their details have been added to the sub-account and numbers will be tracked via the LMS (Learning Management System)
•	Tracking will be done quarterly and  in cohorts although this  may need to be done  more often to cover new starters etc.
•	 There will be no uplift in costs over the life of the contract except for additional licences, if required.
•	Any additional places purchased over the 500 in year 4 would also get 12 months to complete from enrolment (subject to a contract extension) 
•	Supplier  will continue to provide individual   usage data during any extended contract period 
•	The LMS annual costs for the life of the contract will be covered as a whole contract and not individually per person.

Title: SDF Lot 8 Area 13_ Route One Infrastructure Limited A
Description:
National Highways continues to roll out the Asset Delivery model to its operational areas. There is a
requirement to deliver a range of renewal, improvement and selected small scheme construction works on the
Strategic Road Network in areas utilising specialist contractors working collaboratively with National Highways
to deliver these works. It is envisaged that this framework will straddle two Road Investment Strategy (RIS)
periods (RIS 2 and RIS 3) enabling a smooth transition between them. Works for schemes have been divided
into a number of workstreams that align with the contractors' specialisms, and will also include design.
Bandings have been introduced into the framework model to differentiate some contracting terms between
bands.

This award is for Lot 8 Structures Waterproofing and Expansion Joints in the National Highways Area 13.

This Lot covers the supply of materials, plant and labour for the installation of and repair work to;
- Highways structure expansion joints,
- Waterproofing systems,
- Testing of existing waterproofing systems, and
- Installation, maintenance and removal of any temporary works required to ensure a safe method of working

Other duties
This scope also includes:
- Mobilisation
- Early Contractor Involvement
- Welfare facilities
- Manage Network Occupancy
- Community; and
- Contingency
The scope may also include carrying out some of the duties of the Maintenance & Response Contractor and providing Incident Response (Rapid Response) when instructed.

Title: Trees for Climate: Year 2 - Woodland Planting and Maintenance at Various Sites
Description:
On 11 March 2020, the government announced the creation of a £640m "Nature for Climate" Programme. This funding is to support nature-based solutions such as woodland creation and peatland restoration, as part of an array of actions needed to reach the UK government target of net zero carbon by 2050.

As part of the Nature for Climate programme, the England's Community Forests (ECF) network, led by The Mersey Forest and supported by the Community Forest Trust, has been tasked by DEFRA with putting together a 6,000+ hectare programme of new woodland creation, called 'Trees for Climate' (T4C), to be delivered over the period 2020 to 2025.

Greenwood Community Forest, part of Nottinghamshire County Council (NCC) will lead on the T4C programme in Nottinghamshire. As part of the indicative pipeline of projects for the programme, Greenwood has indicated that it would be able to facilitate the establishment of 250ha of new woodland, with both direct delivery of schemes and working through partner organisations.

For Year 2 (2021/22) of T4C, Greenwood is intending on planting 3 sites, two owned by Nottinghamshire County Council and one owned by Newark and Sherwood District Council of which is the subject of this tender and is shown in Appendix 1 - Year 2 T4C Planting Site 1:

The Site is former colliery pit tip, restored to a mix of woodland and low-grade agricultural grassland. The planting scheme will take place on the grassland areas, which are undulating in topography with some steep slopes, vehicle wheeling ruts and poorly drained areas. It should be noted the Site suffers from unauthorised off-road usage (4x4s and trail bikes).

The scheme has been designed to comply with the UK Forestry Standard, and to deliver native broad-leaved woodland and various associated outputs including carbon sequestration, biodiversity, water quality and public access.

In order to maximise the chances of being able to undertake the planting work this planting season, we are now seeking to appoint a Planting Contractor with the relevant skills and experience, and the ability to deliver within the specified timeframe.

requirement to deliver a range of renewal, improvement and selected small scheme construction works on the
Strategic Road Network in areas utilising specialist contractors working collaboratively with National Highways

periods (RIS 2 and RIS 3) enabling a smooth transition between them. Works for schemes have been divided
into a number of workstreams that align with the contractors' specialisms, and will also include design.
Bandings have been introduced into the framework model to differentiate some contracting terms between

This award is for Lot 10 Structures, Structural Services and Concrete Repairs in the National Highways Area 12.

Title: Survey of Employers providing Benefits in Kind BiKs
Description:
HMRC is interested in conducting quantitative and qualitative research to understand how and why employers offer Benefits in Kind (BiKs), their overall cost and their prevalence. The current regime undervalues BiKs, does not properly take account of earnings and is complex to administer. Major changes, such as the ban on new diesel and petrol car sales from 2030, require reforms.
Evidence will inform reforms to simplify administration and potentially raise £1bn revenue. It will also cost 10 unvalued BiKs tax reliefs, allowing HMRC to address knowledge gaps which, following NAO, OBR and PAC scrutiny, it has publicly committed to overcoming.

Title: Online Time Use Survey (OTUS) - AWARD
Description:
ONS has developed an online time diary, with which to collect a regular online time use survey (and has done so in 3 waves between 2020 and 2021). This new data will help the ONS to capture further information about the UK economy and aspects of day to day life in the UK which is otherwise unrecorded. 
      For this purpose, ONS require a sample of individuals to complete the online time use survey or a modal alternative (e.g., telephone interviewer) substitute diary for those without internet access or who prefer not to access online surveys.
      It is important to ensure UK Representability, through a probability-based sampling approach.

Title: RFQ: Concept Testing: Whole Population Approach to Mental Wellbeing 2022
Description:
Liverpool City Council is looking for an agency to carry out concept testing research for a behaviour change campaign.

The overarching objective of the campaign is to engage the whole of Liverpool to:

• acknowledge how the pandemic has affected people's mental wellbeing
• highlight they are not alone in how they could be feeling
• acknowledge that there are many factors affecting the way people feel such as debt, housing, relationships and how these impact on a person's mental wellbeing
• motivate to them to get help whether that be talking with a family member, being more active or accessing mental wellbeing services and support.

We are looking to commission an agency to help us to gather actionable insights to help develop and refine a mental wellbeing creative for the city.

This will ensure a final campaign due to go live in spring 2022 is impactful, feels relevant to Liverpool, strikes a tone which prompts people to consider what they can do, and equips them with the information they need to act.

Title: Managed Service for Special Needs Transport and Associated Services
Description:
The London Borough of Harrow (the "Authority") is seeking to appoint a provider to deliver a Managed Service for the Supply of Staff for Special Needs Transport (SNT) and Associated Services.
The successful provider will directly provide and manage drivers and passenger assistants, including on-site supervision, staff attendance management, provision of replacement staff, and coordination on all matters relating to this provision of staff and service delivery.
The services include the transportation of service users to schools in the boroughs of Harrow and Brent, and adults to day centres and other activities. 
This contract for the Managed Service for the Supply of Staff for Special Needs Transport and Associated Services is commissioned by the London Borough of Harrow on behalf of both Harrow and Brent Councils.
The successful  provider will directly provide and manage drivers and passenger assistants and manage key aspects of the service requirements for provision of driver and passenger assistants for the SNT Service based at the Harrow Central Depot. Harrow Council currently delivers passenger transport services for children and young people with Special Educational Needs as well as to vulnerable adults on behalf of Harrow and Brent Councils. The SNT service utilises a fleet of 162 minibuses provided by the Authority and operating from the Central Depot.  There are approximately 350 staff covering both Harrow & Brent routes of which approximately 80 (35 drivers / 45 Passenger Assistants) are employed by the Authority. The remaining staff (approximately 270) are expected to be provided by the Service Provider. These will included both drivers and passenger assistants.  These numbers will be subject to change during the term of the contract and are provided as an indication only.
The aim of the service is to ensure the provision of a safe, reliable and consistent service for those that are eligible, in accordance with the following guidelines:
•	Safe: The safety of each service user is of over-riding importance 
•	Reliable: Service users must arrive at the right location and on time; and 
•	Consistent: Minimising variations of drivers and passenger assistants

Title: The Suffolk Adult Drug and Alcohol Inpatient Detoxification and Residential Rehabilitation Framework - AWARD
Description:
Suffolk County Council is seeking to establish a Framework Agreement to provide the provision of inpatient detoxification and residential rehabilitation services for people who are in treatment with the Community Treatment Provider for drugs and/or alcohol who require public funding in order to access treatment in a specialist facility. 
      
      The framework will give options and flexibility to ensure that service users' needs are matched to appropriate high quality service provision for those assessed as requiring funded in-patient detoxification and / or residential rehabilitation. The options may be delivered by a range of providers to support people who have been unable to successfully achieve abstinence and recover in the community and where there is rationale to support the need to access treatment in a specialist facility.
      
      This procurement is for services listed within schedule 3 of The Public Contracts Regulations 2015 and as a result are subject to the Light Touch Regime under those regulations. Therefore, the Council is not obliged to comply with the full requirements of the 2015 Regulations, however the principles will be applied.
      
      At the Councils discretion, the Framework may be re-opened (in whole or in part) once each Framework Year (or more often if required), to allow the Council to fill any gaps on the Framework or to fill any gaps which may have arisen as a result of any of the service providers appointed to the Framework being suspended or removed from the Framework for any reason or where there is a legitimate requirement for increased capacity on the Framework. Any new entrants will be required to meet the original tender requirements before being appointed to the Framework. Existing Providers would be invited to re-submit their tender response should they wish to do so. Flexibility within the contract framework is required in instances such as a pandemic, whereby ability to access detox and/or rehabilitation in a timely manner can be compromised. 
      
      The framework will be available for use by Suffolk County Council and may also be made available to other public contracting authorities within the geographical boundaries of the East of England including other county councils, district and borough councils and health authorities. It is becoming established practice for government bodies to work closely together and share contract opportunities. 
      
      The majority of placements under this framework will be by direct award however there may be occasion where there will be a mini-competition if it is in the best interests of the Service User. The framework will be for a duration of 2 years commencing 1st April 2022 with the option to extend for up to a further 2 years. The anticipated value of the framework is approximately £380,000 per annum. However, no guarantee or commitment as to the initial and future value of any work arising from this framework can be given. The framework will consist of 3 lots and th...

Title: AI Tech Watch Deep Dives
Description:
Dstl has a requirement to increase its knowledge and understanding of the state-of-the-art in Artificial Intelligence (AI) research around two specific areas - Broad AI, and Machine Assisted Forecasting and Prediction.
 For each area, we are seeking a technical deep dive report which should contain:
•	An overview of the key technical observations across each AI topic, drawing together the relevant research from both recent publications as well as still-current techniques which may have been known for some time
•	A series of observations on the topic, providing commentary on public announcements and / or academic articles made by industry and academia
•	Next steps, which recommend further work with Dstl or partners could undertake to better understand the implications for Defence.
Each report should be produced to a high quality and be suitable for sharing with other stakeholders within HM Government, and our 5-eyes international partners.
The activity should be confined to the topics of interest, and be undertaken by technical experts in that specialty.  This approach will provide a coherent overview of the topic, with deep technical insight.

Title: Bromley Charter Market Stalls Assembly Service
Description:
The London Borough of Bromley ("the Council") is inviting tenders for the assembly and maintenance of the market stalls for its weekly Charter Market held in Bromley Town Centre. The stalls are required to be set up every Thursday morning and taken down every Saturday evening.  
The Tender is being advertised in two Lots: -
	Lot 1 - Market Stall Assembly
        Lot 2 - Market Stall Maintenance
Lot 1 - Market Stall Assembly: There is currently a maximum of 46 stall positions on the Bromley Town Centre site which runs from Bromley Market Square to the Churchill Theatre all year round. The number of stalls vary each week depending on the number of traders who have booked. Trader numbers and stall pitch locations will be confirmed to the successful provider each week by midday on the Wednesday. Additional there is an extended market held each Christmas, typically this will run for the period two weeks prior to Christmas and ending on Christmas Eve.
Lot 2: Market Stall Maintenance: The successful provider will need to undertake regular cleaning of the stalls footing fixtures, keep the Market Stores in good order and liaise with the Market Supervisor and undertake any ad-hoc tasks requested by the Supervisor to support the operational running of the market. 
The value stated in section 1 is the indicative value for the initial term and the 2 year extension. The initial term is 24 months long, with an option to extend the Contract, at the Council's discretion, for a period of 24 months from 2.1.2024 to 1.1.2026.

Title: Growth Hub Evaluation Reporting and Quality Assurance
Description:
The services provided by the Growth Hub are subject to rigorous scrutiny by its funding bodies through monitoring and evaluation of the impact and quality of the services provided.

The GBSLEP Growth Hub is seeking the provision of high quality strategic, process and impact evaluation of its activities to provide evidence-based reporting to inform future interventions, continuous improvement, and to evidence and provide assurance of quality delivery. 

The Provider will be required to Liaise with Growth Hub Staff and clients to produce reporting and evaluation to funder timeframes, this will include but is not limited to:

•	Quarterly Growth Hub monitoring reports 
•	BEIS Half Yearly Report in line with BEIS reporting frameworks
•	BEIS Yearly Report and Evaluation
•	ERDF Summative Assessment 

Full documentation is available via the GBSLEP website:

Title: UK SBS - PS21157 - Scoping Report on Environmental Sensors in India and the UK
Description:
***** THIS IS AN AWARD NOTICE, NOT A CALL FOR COMPETITION *****

The final date and time for the submission of bids is Thursday 4th November 2021 at 11:00 

Brief Description of Requirement

UK Research and Innovation (UKRI) and Department of Science and Technology (DST) are inviting proposals to deliver a scoping exercise to identify emerging research priorities in the area of low-cost environmental pollution sensor development and use. Up to £30,000 (inc. VAT) is available to support this work and the final outputs must be delivered by 15 March 2022. This opportunity is open to proposals from teams working in both the UK and India - applicants must be able to demonstrate that they have a well-established UK-India partnership and an ability to deliver evidence covering both countries.

Please ensure you review all attached information to ensure a full understanding of this requirement. All attachments can be found with the Document Uploads tab within the Delta eSourcing Portal. 

This contract will be awarded based on the evaluation criteria as set out in the  ITQ document. 

How to Apply

UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) will be using the Delta eSourcing Portal for this procurement. 

To register on the Delta eSourcing portal please use the link https://www.delta-esourcing.com/ and follow the instructions to register.

If you are already registered on the Delta eSourcing Portal and wish to participate in this procurement, please use the link: https://www.delta-esourcing.com/ and the follow the instructions to 'Log in' 

Once you are logged into the system you will be able to link yourself into this procurement using the Access Code: VG7932C8N5
Additional Text:
DO NOT APPLY DIRECTLY TO BUYER

All submissions will be assessed in accordance with the Public Procurement Regulations that apply to this opportunity.

Responses must be received by the date and time in the tender documentation; responses received outside of the deadline or not sent via the Delta eSourcing portal will not be accepted or considered by the Contracting Authority further for this opportunity. Interested organisations should ensure that they allow a sufficiency of time, prior to the deadline to allow all sections to be completed in full and any attachments to be uploaded.

As a user of the Delta eSourcing Portal you will have access to the Delta messaging service which facilitates all messages sent to you and from you, as well as other messages and updates in relation to any specific tender event. Please note that any and all information secured outside of the messaging service, shall have no merit or worth and should not be relied upon by any organisation submitting a tender response. 

Please note it is your organisations responsibility to access these messages on a regular basis to ensure you have sight of all relevant information applicable to this opportunity.

The Contracting Authority expressly reserves the right:

i.	not to award any contract as a result of the procurement process commenced by publication of this notice; and

ii.	to make whatever changes it may see fit to the content and structure of the procurement; and under no circumstances as part of your organisations participation in this opportunity, will the Contracting Authority be liable for any costs incurred by any organisation as a result. If the Contracting Authority decides to enter into a contract with any successful organisation(s), this does not mean that there is any guarantee of subsequent contracts being awarded. Any expenditure, work or effort undertaken prior to contract award is accordingly a matter solely for the commercial judgement of your organisation in doing so.

About UK Shared Business Services 

UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) brings a commercial attitude to the public sector; helping our contracting authorities to improve efficiency, generate savings and modernise.

Where UK SBS is not named as the Contracting Authority within the documentation, UK SBS will be acting as an agent on behalf of the Contracting Authority.

Our broad range of expert services is shared by our customers. This allows our customers the freedom to focus resources on core activities; innovating and transforming their own organisations.

For full details of our partner base please review the following link: http://www.uksbs.co.uk/services/procure/contracts/Pages/default.aspx

Title: SDF Lot 7 Area 14_ Mason Street Furniture B
Description:
National Highways continues to roll out the Asset Delivery model to its operational areas. There is a
requirement to deliver a range of renewal, improvement and selected small scheme construction works on the Strategic Road Network in areas utilising specialist contractors working collaboratively with National Highways to deliver these works. It is envisaged that this framework will straddle two Road Investment Strategy (RIS) periods (RIS 2 and RIS 3) enabling a smooth transition between them. Works for schemes have been divided into a number of workstreams that align with the contractors' specialisms, and will also include design. Bandings have been introduced into the framework model to differentiate some contracting terms between bands.

This award is for Lot 7 Road Lighting and Electrical Works in the National Highways Area 14.

This Lot covers the supply of materials, plant and labour for the installation, removal and commissioning of;

- Road Lighting, and
- Illuminated signs and other highway electrical equipment

Other duties

This scope also includes:
- Mobilisation
- Early Contractor Involvement
- Elements of Supplier Design
- Welfare facilities
- Manage Network Occupancy
- Community; and
- Contingency

The scope may also include carrying out some of the duties of the Maintenance & Response Contractor and providing Incident Response (Rapid Response) when instructed.

Title: SDF Lot 7 East_ Mason Street Furniture A
Description:
National Highways continues to roll out the Asset Delivery model to its operational areas. There is a
requirement to deliver a range of renewal, improvement and selected small scheme construction works on the
Strategic Road Network in areas utilising specialist contractors working collaboratively with National Highways
to deliver these works. It is envisaged that this framework will straddle two Road Investment Strategy (RIS)
periods (RIS 2 and RIS 3) enabling a smooth transition between them. Works for schemes have been divided
into a number of workstreams that align with the contractors' specialisms, and will also include design.
Bandings have been introduced into the framework model to differentiate some contracting terms between
bands.

This award is for Lot 7 Road Lighting and Electrical Works in the East region (National Highways Areas 6 and 8).

This Lot covers the supply of materials, plant and labour for the installation, removal and commissioning of;

- Road Lighting, and
- Illuminated signs and other highway electrical equipment

Other duties

This scope also includes:
- Mobilisation
- Early Contractor Involvement
- Elements of Supplier Design
- Welfare facilities
- Manage Network Occupancy
- Community; and
- Contingency

The scope may also include carrying out some of the duties of the Maintenance & Response Contractor and providing Incident Response (Rapid Response) when instructed.

Title: SDF Lot 5 Area 12_ Green Valley Arborists Ltd A
Description:
National Highways continues to roll out the Asset Delivery model to its operational areas. There is a
requirement to deliver a range of renewal, improvement and selected small scheme construction works on the
Strategic Road Network in areas utilising specialist contractors working collaboratively with National Highways
to deliver these works. It is envisaged that this framework will straddle two Road Investment Strategy (RIS)
periods (RIS 2 and RIS 3) enabling a smooth transition between them. Works for schemes have been divided
into a number of workstreams that align with the contractors' specialisms, and will also include design.
Bandings have been introduced into the framework model to differentiate some contracting terms between
bands.

This award is for Lot 5 Landscaping and Ecology in the National Highways Area 12.

This Lot covers the supply of materials, plant and labour to carry out landscaping and ecology works including;

- Weed control,
- Wildlife control,
- Ground preparation,
- Seeding,
- Turfing,
- Planting,
- Watering,
- Tree and shrub maintenance,
- Creation and Management of waterbodies and any other ecological measures, and
- Landscape clearance

Other duties

This scope also includes:
- Mobilisation
- Early Contractor Involvement
- Welfare facilities
- Manage Network Occupancy
- Community; and
- Contingency

The scope may also include carrying out some of the duties of the Maintenance & Response Contractor and providing Incident Response (Rapid Response) when instructed.

Title: CEFAS21-124 RFQ for Gas Chromatograph - Electron Capture Detector (GC-ECD)
Description:
There is a requirement for a gas chromatograph with electron capture detection system (GC-ECD) to maintain Cefas' capability for specialist environmental contaminants determination at trace and ultra-trace level in the marine environment. The capability will enable the targeted analysis of known halogenated Persistent Organic Pollutants (POPs) (such as polychlorinated biphenyls (PCBs) and organochlorine pesticides), in a variety of sample matrices including sediments and biota (e.g. fish, shellfish or aquatic mammals).

The system proposed by the Tenderer must be new with guaranteed support of parts, firmware and software of 10 years or more. The GC-ECD system will consist of the following parts:

1.	 Two (2) automated sample introduction system
2.	 One (1) Gas Chromatograph (GC) with two (2) Electron Capture Detectors
3.	 Chromatographic data system

The system must be supplied with all parts required for installation to integrate with existing facilities so that it is fully operational on installation. The system is to be installed and tested by trained engineers to assure that the components and system are functioning properly and that the installation specifications are met.

Delivery and Installation Requirements:

It is important to Cefas that delivery is made before or during WC 21st March 2022 to ensure payment by end of FY. If delivery cannot be accommodated in this timeframe, Cefas reserve the right to withdraw from the exercise or request additional documentation to be provided as evidence of ownership.

The equipment is required to be delivered/installed to Cefas Lowestoft Laboratory NR33 0HT.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Agilent Technologies LDA UK Ltd|5500 Lakeside, Cheadle, Cheshire, SK8 3GR, UNITED KINGDOM|NONE_OTHER||No|No]

Title: CEFAS21-127 RFQ for Sodium Iodine WEL Counter
Description:
Cefas require a Sodium Iodide Gamma WEL detector equipped with the sample changer to measure low levels of gamma emitters in energy range up to 2 MeV (approx.1 Bq total). The instrument should also be equipped with a radiation shielding, a software-controlled sample changer system and a software for data interpretation. The system must allow the measurements of 5ml and 20ml vials.

Delivery and Installation Requirements:

It is required that delivery is made before or during week commencing 21st March 2022 latest to ensure full payment by end of March 2022. If delivery cannot be accommodated in this timeframe, Cefas reserves the right to withdraw from the exercise or request additional documentation to be provided as evidence of ownership.

The equipment is required to be delivered/installed to Cefas Lowestoft NR33 0HT.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [LabLogic Systems Ltd|Paradigm House, 3 Melbourne Avenue, Sheffield, South Yorkshire, S10 2QJ, UNITED KINGDOM|NONE_OTHER||No|No]

Title: CEFAS21-132 RFQ for nitrogen gas generator
Description:
The Analytical Chemistry laboratory at Cefas Lowestoft has a requirement for one (1) nitrogen gas generator to supply the source of one Orbitrap Exploris™ 120 mass spectrometer from Thermo Scientific.

Requirement:

One (1) nitrogen gas generator capable of supplying nitrogen gas to meet the following requirements:
-	Nitrogen gas purity of 99% or better (high purity)
-	Flow rate generated of 35 L/min, or higher, but no more than 45L/min.
-	Generated pressure of 0.6 MPa ± 0.05 MPa 

Delivery and Installation Requirements:

It is important to Cefas that delivery is made before or during WC 21st March 2022 to ensure payment by end of FY. If delivery cannot be accommodated in this timeframe, Cefas reserve the right to withdraw from the exercise or request additional documentation to be provided as evidence of ownership.

Title: Operation of Core Children's Centres - AWARD
Description:
Sandwell MBC Children's Services is seeking to appoint agencies to operate the core children's centres across the borough as set out in this document. 
      
       Children's centres have evolved across the country over the years but the basic principles of providing early help and support to families remains key to delivery in Sandwell.  
      
      This is not a new service. The authority has developed practice over the years and wishes to maintain many approaches as noted in the specification.  
      
      The authority seeks consistency of practice across the towns but acknowledges that different emphasis will be required to address local issues in different communities.  
      
      The successful agencies will work with the local authority to further develop and enhance the services provided.  
      
      The service has been divided into 3 lots; providers are able to submit tenders for any combination of lots.
      
      The Council will be using the In-tend e-Tendering System for this Procurement exercise, please visit https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sandwellmbc to access the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.
      
      From here you will be able to register your company, express an interest in the opportunity, and gain immediate access to the ITT and other related documents.
      
      In Order To View and Submit a Tender, you will be required to` Opt-In`.   
      
      For a Step by Step user guide to the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal please click on the `Guidance for Suppliers` section of the website. All procurement responses must be carried out via the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.  
      
      If you require further assistance in respect of the system please contact the In-tend support team on 0844 272 8810.
      
      Closing date: XXXXXXXXXXXXX 2020 at 15:00hrs

Title: Lead Auditors Course
Description:
The CA and course provider are to collaboratively establish 8 course dates over a 3-year contract with course dates being agreed annually.
Outputs/deliverables/milestones
 
6 Day (5 day plus exam day) course developed to meet the criteria for a Quality Auditor/Lead Auditor Course recognised by the International Register of Certificated Auditors (IRCA) with the following Learning Objectives:
 
• The purpose, benefits and typical structure of a Quality Management System (QMS)
• Plan-Do-Check Act (PDCA) methodology, and the process approach to Quality Management
• The principles of Quality Management and how they relate to the QMS and ISO 9001 
• The purpose, scope and uses of the ISO 9000 series standards 
• The roles, responsibilities and competence requirements of auditors and lead auditors with reference to ISO 19011 
• The work of Accreditation and Certification Bodies and the work of the IRCA 
 
The course needs to satisfy the requirements to register as a QMS Auditor (any grade) under the IRCA Scheme and to be eligible for membership of the Chartered Quality Institute (CQI) at Practitioner Grade (PCQI)
 
Certificates printed and sent by post to RC A&I
Attachments: Redacted Documents for Lead Auditors Course.zip

Title: Kasbah Conservation Area Management Plan
Description:
EQUANS (formerly know as ENGIE Services Ltd) on behalf of North East Lincolnshire Council are seeking an experienced Consultant (or consultancy team) to prepare a Management Plan for the Kasbah Conservation Area (CA).   

The Kasbah sits within the operational Port of Grimsby, and the entire area is owned by Associated British Ports (ABP). All leaseholders, however, have full repairing and maintaining leases. At present approximately 70% of the buildings are vacant, a number of which are in very poor condition. A Management Plan is therefore required to assist leaseholders, ABP and NELC in the regeneration of what was the largest fishing port in the world in the early-mid C20th.

Title: INVITATION TO TENDER FOR Multi-Axis High Speed CNC Machine Tool
Description:
Sheffield Hallam University requires a Five Axis milling machine tool with its supporting equipment, initial consumables, software, and warranties, for the College of Business, Technology and Engineering (BTE). The equipment is part of a long-term plan to ensure that the University continues to offer an up-to-date, industry-relevant experience to our students and that we teach innovative cutting-edge technologies that not only add to the student experience but also the credibility of the University.

This tender is for the supply, installation, commissioning and warranty and maintenance of a Five Axis milling machine tool. The equipment should have adequate robustness, high precision, and repeatability to facilitate the manufacture of high-performance components that is subject to tolerance requirements. The piece of equipment should allow machining with high pressure coolant, tool coolant, flood coolant and dry cutting.

The intended use of the new 5-axis machine tool is threefold; firstly, it will be used to produce one-off, or small batch of components for projects and students; secondly it will be used to provide the practical principles of CNC and automated manufacture to groups of 10 University undergraduate students.  Finally, it will be used to undertake research in 5-axis machining. This may include cutter analysis (wear, chatter, etc.), developing machining strategies, and machining parameter optimisation. The machine tool will be used to cut mostly aluminium, and occasionally steel and titanium.
