Title: WEEE - Research to identify and address gaps in existing WEEE data relevant to the ongoing policy review
Description:
All four nations of the UK are committed to protecting the environment.  We all want to make our air purer, our water cleaner, our land greener and our food more sustainable. We want to restore and enhance the environment for the next generation, leaving it in a better state than we found it.  A key part of the success of these ambitions will be how we tackle waste. In 2017 Defra published its 25 Year Environment Plan which is a plan of action. It commits us to using resources efficiently and to keep them in use for longer to minimise waste and reduce its environmental impacts by promoting reuse and recycling.  We will work towards eliminating all avoidable waste by 2050 and all avoidable plastic waste over the lifetime of the 25 Year Environment Plan. In 2019, the UK became the first major nation to legislate for net zero carbon emissions by 2050. This means that the government must shape policies and regulations that influence the transition of the whole economy towards net zero. Reducing electronic waste can help to cut carbon emissions. The rise in purchases of electronic goods is a significant driver of emissions globally. By 2040 and on current trends, it is estimated that worldwide emissions from the production and use of electronics could rise to a level exceeding half that associated with the global transportation sector today.
The Resources and Waste Strategy for England published in 2018, adds detail the actions outlined in the 25 Year Environment Plan.  It includes a commitment for the government to work with the devolved nations to consult on changing the waste electrical and electronic (WEEE) and batteries producer responsibility regimes to incentivise more sustainable design, increase recycling and ensure alignment with a common framework. The proposals are part of an ambitious, co-ordinated programme of waste reform which places the principle of producer responsibility at its heart.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Anthesis UK Ltd|Unit J, Taper Studios, 175 Long Lane, Bermondsey, London, SE1 4GT, United Kingdom|NONE_OTHER||No|No]

Title: 2021_CulEng - Internationalisation Learning Cohorts: Going Global Partnerships
Description:
The British Council is seeking a supplier to develop learning outcomes and course content for three Internationalisation Learning Cohorts and to deliver one as a pilot as part of the Going Global Partnerships Programme.

The Internationalisation Learning Cohorts model is a new activity which forms part of the British Council's Going Global Partnerships Programme. The learning cohorts enable the British Council to convene UK and overseas experts and strengthen internationalisation through bringing together an interested cohort of Higher Education Institution (HEI) leaders, senior managers, policymakers to have a sustained dialogue over a relevant theme. This is to enable virtual networking around some significant content of mutual interest, tackling issues together (e.g Internationalisation of higher education; understanding transnational education, innovative approaches to TNE). The cohort structure is adaptable to the desired learning outcomes of each cohort and scalable for future iterations. The initial, proposed format is for a cohort to meet for a 1.5-2 hour discussion every two weeks for a total of four sessions.

Each session will be led by an experienced online facilitator and will feature a relevant thought piece from an expert, followed by a discussion. Every cohort, through its discussions, activities and knowledge-sharing, will make a knowledge contribution to the wider cohort network and will build up a bank of experience and good practice in internationalisation, shared online.

To address this requirement, the British Council is seeking a learning facilitator with experience in course design and delivery to create and disseminate online content and training in international higher education. The successful applicant will use sector knowledge to identify and collaborate with experts in various thematic areas and deliver an initial series of pilot learning cohorts for representatives from higher education institutions throughout the world.
Additional Text:
Bidders will be required to register on British Council`s e-Tendering portal In-Tend hosted at https://in-tendhost.co.uk/britishcouncil 
in order to take part in the tender process.

Once registered, bidders must log-in to the website where they can view the project and access the bidders pack and submit their return.

Bidders will also be required to demonstrate their capability and `means of proof` will be required. These conditions are outlined in the RFP.

Title: Proceeds of Crime - Asset Realisation Service for City of London Police
Description:
**PLEASE NOTE** This is an Award Notice and the opportunity is now closed.

City of London Police invited tenders to set up a single provider framework for the disposal of surplus assets through sale at Public Auction.

The service is intended to cover assets seized or obtained pursuant to Confiscation Orders issued by the Court under the Proceeds of Crime Act (POCA) 2002, Police and Criminal Evidence Act 1984, Drug Trafficking Act 1994 and Criminal Justice Act 1988 or such amended legislation as from time to time in force.

All items offered for sale under the agreement will be legitimate pre-purchased goods. The proceeds from confiscation orders will go back into the public purse to fund future prosecutions and benefit the community, with the Contractor maximising the return on the items sold.

The goods offered for sale are expected to fall under the following areas, although it should be noted this list is not exhaustive and the Contractor may be asked to deal with the sales of other types of property CoLP have permission to sell.

- Cars, motorcycles, bicycles, miscellaneous vehicles and personal registrations (vehicle number plates)
- Jewellery, fine art, antiques and memorabilia
- Personal property, other miscellaneous property (items such as designer clothing and accessories, electronic equipment, televisions, music systems,
games, computers, sports equipment and furniture)

The duration of the contract is two (2) years, with the option to extend for a further two (2) years on a year-by-year basis.

Title: NEA - MMF - Howden-le-Wear and Crook Modelling and Mapping
Description: Modelling at Howden-le-Wear and Crook has been identified as requiring progression this financial year. The Crook Beck, Beechburn Beck and Howden Beck are all main rivers, flowing into the River Wear. All three channels are flanked by high ground. The catchment is ungauged and there are no plans to add additional telemetry in this financial year.The project will be delivered in two key milestone phases, under one contract. Phase 1 will be carried out during 2022 and will involve a data review, production of a model method statement, survey scoping and a site visits (following COVID-19 guidance). Phase 2 will be completed during 2022 and will involve hydrological assessments, model build and design runs.

Title: The Design and Build of Temporary Accommodation at Herbert Avenue
Description:
Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole Council (BCP Council) via Poole Housing Partnership Ltd (PHP) its Arms-length management organisation (ALMO) seeks tenders to construct 2 blocks of purpose-built apartments at 56 Herbert Avenue Poole BH12 4EE, which will provide 24 units of accommodation for homeless families in the Poole neighbourhood. 

The 24 homes are to be used as temporary accommodation enabling people to be housed safely and securely until a permanent solution is found. Included in the 24 is to be 3 wheelchair accessible homes (1x 3bed 1x 2bed 1x 1bed). The units are to be well insulated to limit fuel poverty and to reduce energy consumption in use. The homes to be user friendly given the nature of the accommodation. The homes are to have the ability to be adapted to meet the future requirements of the Council.

The majority of all new homes and buildings that the Employer produces shall utilise modern methods of construction, usually timber frame construction for houses.  Modular / closed panel construction and insulated concrete form construction would be considered.

Notice Identifier: PS21166 - The impact of COVID 19 on methodological innovation
Title: PS21166 - The impact of COVID 19 on methodological innovation
Description:
***** THIS IS AN AWARD NOTICE, NOT A CALL FOR COMPETITION *****

The final date and time for the submission of bids is Tuesday, 23rd November 2021 11:00am.

DO NOT apply directly to the buyer.

All tender information MUST be submitted through the Delta eSourcing Portal.

Brief Description of Requirement

We would like to commission a review that seeks to better understand and capture learning from the methodological innovations taking place in social science research in ESRC-led grants funded through the UKRI COVID Rolling Call . This will give us a more comprehensive picture of the different types of innovation that have come out of changed methodological practices and may help to shape priority areas for future investment in methodological development and innovation. 

The objectives for this review are to:
•	Identify the methodological innovations that have taken place in ESRC-led projects funded through the UKRI UKRI COVID Rolling Call 
•	Understand those innovations of value in an emergency context (such as a pandemic) and those innovations likely to have a lasting impact on how we undertake social science research
•	Develop case studies showcasing high-impact methodological innovations
•	Understand the extent to which these innovations have been shared with the wider social science research community
•	Identify training and capacity building opportunities to raise awareness of and increase uptake of innovations
•	Identify areas of methodological innovation that require further development to maximise their impact and that would benefit from further research funding

Please ensure you review all attached information to ensure a full understanding of this requirement. All attachments can be found with the Document Uploads tab within the Delta eSourcing Portal. 

This contract will be awarded based on the evaluation criteria as set out in the ITQ document. 

How to Apply

UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) will be using the Delta eSourcing Portal for this procurement. 

To register on the Delta eSourcing portal please use the link https://www.delta-esourcing.com/ and follow the instructions to register.

If you are already registered on the Delta eSourcing Portal and wish to participate in this procurement, please use the link: https://www.delta-esourcing.com/ and the follow the instructions to 'Log in' 

Once you are logged into the system you will be able to link yourself into this procurement using the Access Code: 4UGAZ37VZV
Attachments: PS21166 - Annex A.pdf PS21166 - AW3.1 ITQ Validation check.pdf PS21166 - AW4.1 Terms and Conditions .pdf PS21166 - AW5.2 Price Schedule.xlsx PS21166 - ITQ Invitation to Quote Questions.pdf PS21166 - ITQ Invitation to Quote.pdf PS21166 - AW4.1 Terms and Conditions - Countersigned_Redactedv1.pdf
Additional Text:
DO NOT APPLY DIRECTLY TO BUYER

All submissions will be assessed in accordance with the Public Procurement Regulations that apply to this opportunity.

Responses must be received by the date and time in the tender documentation; responses received outside of the deadline or not sent via the Delta eSourcing portal will not be accepted or considered by the Contracting Authority further for this opportunity. Interested organisations should ensure that they allow a sufficiency of time, prior to the deadline to allow all sections to be completed in full and any attachments to be uploaded.

As a user of the Delta eSourcing Portal you will have access to the Delta messaging service which facilitates all messages sent to you and from you, as well as other messages and updates in relation to any specific tender event. Please note that any and all information secured outside of the messaging service, shall have no merit or worth and should not be relied upon by any organisation submitting a tender response. 

Please note it is your organisations responsibility to access these messages on a regular basis to ensure you have sight of all relevant information applicable to this opportunity.

The Contracting Authority expressly reserves the right:

i.	not to award any contract as a result of the procurement process commenced by publication of this notice; and

ii.	to make whatever changes it may see fit to the content and structure of the procurement; and under no circumstances as part of your organisations participation in this opportunity, will the Contracting Authority be liable for any costs incurred by any organisation as a result. If the Contracting Authority decides to enter into a contract with any successful organisation(s), this does not mean that there is any guarantee of subsequent contracts being awarded. Any expenditure, work or effort undertaken prior to contract award is accordingly a matter solely for the commercial judgement of your organisation in doing so.

About UK Shared Business Services 

UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) brings a commercial attitude to the public sector; helping our contracting authorities to improve efficiency, generate savings and modernise.

Where UK SBS is not named as the Contracting Authority within the documentation, UK SBS will be acting as an agent on behalf of the Contracting Authority.

Our broad range of expert services is shared by our customers. This allows our customers the freedom to focus resources on core activities; innovating and transforming their own organisations.

For full details of our partner base please review the following link: http://www.uksbs.co.uk/services/procure/contracts/Pages/default.aspx

Title: Town Centre Recovery and Development Plans  for NHDC - AWARD
Description:
NHDC wishes to commission a consultant to help them and their partners devise covid recovery and development plans for each of the main towns in the district.   
      
      The district of North Hertfordshire has three market towns, Hitchin, Baldock and Royston, and Letchworth Garden City, the world's first Garden City. The strengths and character of each town centre differs as does their resilience to the impacts of the Covid pandemic. See section 5 below for more information about the towns.
       
      Within this context, as a part of the North Herts Welcome Back Fund programme, the Council wishes to work with key  stakeholders in each town to map out 
      
      a) a high level strategic and effective covid recovery plan for its town centres in the short term together with
      b) a medium- and longer-  term development strategy framework to assist the town centres develop successfully over the next decade. 
      
      As part of the council's emerging Local Plan, Policy  SP4 Town Centres, Local Centres and Community Shops makes reference to reviewing each of its town centre strategies. This work will commence within 12 months of the adoption of the Local Plan and will inform whether it is necessary to review the retail strategy set out in the local Plan. This commission will help inform the scope of work associated with review of the town centre strategies.
      
      The Council is seeking suitability experienced consultancy support with this initial strategic work in preparing plans for each of its town centres.

Title: Electronic Eyecare Referral Systems - Hertfordshire and West Essex ICS
Description:
The purpose of this Notice is to provide information on the recently awarded contract for an Electronic Eyecare Referral System (EeRS) within the Hertfordshire and West Essex Integrated Care System.

The Hertfordshire and West Essex ICS are working to improve Ophthalmology services across primary, community and secondary care.  This is in order to respond to an ever-increasing demand for secondary care services.  The demand is predicted to rise as a result of earlier diagnosis for chronic conditions, new treatments, increasing population changes and the damaging impacts of the coronavirus pandemic.

Eye care services have traditionally been a hospital-based speciality, however, with the development of advanced equipment and education, many ophthalmic assessments and treatments can be carried out effectively in primary care settings.  

On 22nd November 2021 West Essex Clinical Commissioning Group (as the host CCG on behalf of the Herts and West Essex ICS) published a call-off tender using the national Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) for Electronic Eyecare Referral Systems which was established in January 2021.  Following a compliant procurement process the contract has been awarded to Nonmedical Limited trading as Cinapsis.

The initial contract is for a pilot which will be delivered across the East and North Hertfordshire CCG area, should this pilot be successful the service will be extended across Herts Valleys CCG and West Essex CCG areas.  The contract will be for a period of 12 months with the option to extend for a further 12 months (1st April 2022 to 31st March 2023 with the option to extend from 1st April 2023 to 31st March 2024).

The contract value is for the 2 year period and may increase should the service be extended to other commissioning organisations across the HWE ICS up to a maximum of £147,000.
Contact Address 1: Building 4 Spencer Close, St Margaret's Hospital, The Plain
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Nonmedical Limited trading as Cinapsis|Red House, Cemetery Pales, Brookwood, Woking, Surrey, GU24 0BL|NONE_OTHER||No|No]

Work with the Ministry of Justice Portal

Notice Identifier: UoS/OW/21/22/QTR1/Academic Profile and Research Info System
Title: Academic Profile and Research Information System
Description:
Given the internal and external environments, there is a need to make much more intelligent use of our research information to inform investment and strategic decision making with the aim of supporting academics, increasing our research performance, and generating more effective return on the investment in research workload allocations. 
The University currently has a number of disparate systems and processes which are used to manage research and its associated information and outputs, including the research bids and awards database, the University of Salford Institutional Repository (USIR), the ethics applications and approval process and Banner for storing PGR student records.  

Six distinct areas of service have been identified and have been split into three lots.  They are as follows:

Lot 1 - Bids & Awards Contract Management, REF preparation & submission and Research outputs repository.
Lot 2 - PGR Progression
Lot 3 - Ethics Applications and Approvals

For full tender information and to express an interest, please visit the University's InTend portal via: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/salford/aspx/Home.

Title: Property Management Services - SR721641245
Description:
The services will: 

a) follow the award of a Property Freezing Order in favour of HMRC to allow HMRC to remove assets where HMRC can evidence property/assets have been obtained through unlawful conduct or organised crime. A "Property Freezing Order" freezes assets or property (i.e. legally prevent the disposal of those assets by a respondent).

b) The services will follow the award of an Order for Sale in favour of HMRC. An "Order for Sale" is a court order to sell a property or an asset so a debt can be paid out of the proceeds of the sale.

Title: Solar Canopy Site Assessment and Detailed Feasibility Study
Description:
As part of its commitment to become carbon neutral by 2030, Kingston upon Hull City Council ("the Council") is keen to promote the use of renewable energy and low carbon technologies within the city.  The installation of generation assets and energy storage will contribute to the city's decarbonisation agenda and will increase renewable energy generation, decrease reliance on power from centralised production, increase local energy security and resilience and potentially provide the Council, with a long-term low carbon revenue source. This project will form part of a wider scheme of energy decarbonisation within the City and is a key element of the City Plan ,  and 2030 Carbon Neutral Strategy The Council intends to appoint consultants to undertake Initial Site Assessments and Detailed Feasibility for the installation of solar canopy systems on surface car parks and multi-storey car parks with complementary energy storage solutions. 
Full details are available on the Council's electronic tender portal, yortender, accessible via weblink https://uk.eu-supply.com/ under contract reference 47625.

Title: Natural England (NE) National Trails  website 2022 for Hosting, development,  support and maintenance.
Description:
Natural England's (NE) priorities for 2020 to 2025 are in supporting the government's 25 Year Environment Plan and aims for people connected to the natural environment for their own and society's wellbeing, enjoyment and prosperity.  To support this Natural England (working with Natural Resources Wales) provides a website allowing citizens to find and plan trail walks in England and Wales:
Find your perfect trail, and discover the land of myths and legend - National Trails
The National Trails website is an established and well used website with circa 1.5 million unique users annually. Not only does it provide the public with information on trail routes but also on facilities, inspiration and events to better enable them to access and enjoy the trails.  

NE anticipate on-going development requirement under this new agreement will be minimal, there will be a need for specific development support during the period Jan to March 2022. This will primarily be to implement necessary changes to ensure the website meets government accessibility requirements and to create some additional functionality/features on the website platform. In addition there will be the need to regularly add mapping information on new stretches of the England Coast Path National Trail, possibly every month.

Requirement is for hosting, maintenance, development and content management support for the National Trails website.
Additional Text: Please note that Defra procurement uses an E-tendering system for Procurement activities.  This is currently provided by Bravo Solutions.   To access appropriate tendering and contractual documents, please access the E-Tendering portal at https://defra.bravosolution.co.uk", ensuring that your registration includes "Defra".  If you have any problems with this system, please contact Bravo on their telephone helpline number 0800 368 4850 or by emailing them at help@bravosolution.co.uk

Title: Production Insurance Claims Management Service
Description:
The requirement is for a production insurance claims management service capable of responding effectively to the wide variety of claims circumstances falling under BBC Production Insurance agreements for in-house and BBC commissioned independent productions. The service will involve dealing with cast, negative film and digital (including faulty stock, camera and processing), props, sets and wardrobe, miscellaneous equipment, extra expense, third party property damage, office contents, money and securities related claims. The main elements of the service will include:

- The provision of claims managements and associated data management services for Production Insurance Claims (excluding Casualty classes) up to a value of £250,000.

- The recovery of insured and uninsured losses from other involved parties where appropriate.

- Liaison with BBC contractors, BBC departments (including subsidiaries), BBC Commissioned Independent Productions and in particular the BBC's Insurance Department to ensure that information is made available to relevant parties and acted upon in the best interest of the BBC and claims records are accurate and up to date.

- An agreed fee structure for Production Insurance claims exceeding GBP 250,000 where the successful Applicant may be instructed on an individual basis.

The initial term of the contract will be for a period of 3 years with 2 additional optional extension periods of 12 months each.

Title: T0194 TETI9000 Enclosed car parks - fire safety guidance for electric vehicle parking
Description: To produce a literature review of the risks associated with electric vehicle (EV) fires in enclosed or open-sided car parks. From this, produce a guidance document for operators, owners, and designers of both new and existing enclosed or open-sided car parks, on the safety considerations, measures and mitigations for EV fires in enclosed or open-sided car parks. The literature review should provide a complete state-of-the-art, by reviewing existing literature and guidance, including evidence available internationally from policy development and academic research. It should clearly identify the risks posed by EV fires in enclosed or open-sided car parks, and any gaps in current research and guidance. The guidance document should detail the potential mitigations and measures that can be taken when allowing EVs to park and/or charge in and installing EV chargepoints in enclosed or open-sided car parks.

Title: Provision of PFI Exit and Expiry Advice
Description:
2.1	The Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency ("DVLA" or the "Authority") is an Executive Agency of the Department for Transport, based in Swansea, employing around 6,500 staff. The Agency's primary aims are to facilitate road safety and general law enforcement by maintaining accurate registers of drivers and vehicle keepers, and to collect Vehicle Excise Duty. 

2.2	In March 2005 DVLA entered a 20-year PFI contract with Telereal Trillium (TT) for the refurbishment of the estate and the provision of facilities management ("FM") services.  DVLA and TT have agreed that DVLA has the option to de-scope the Soft Services element from the contract from 31st March 2023 (partial Termination). The contract expires on 31st March 2025.  

2.3	A FM Futures programme was formed in 2019 within which the PFI Contract Expiry Team has the remit to deliver an effective contract expiry and transition from the current PFI contract. The team comprises DVLA Estates Management, Contract Expiry & Commercial and Project management personnel.  A business case was approved by the DVLA Executive team in January 2021 that supported procurement of specialist advice to the programme.

2.4	The PFI contract expiry requires that all assets are returned to DVLA in good condition.  The expiry also means that it will be necessary to transition to a different operating model for the delivery of all FM services.  It is with both of these challenges that DVLA requires PFI Contract Expiry specialist to provide contract/commercial perspective input to managing

I.	Supplier compliance to contract expiry
II.	the scope of assets to be returned and the efficacy of the asset register 
III.	handling of the results of a recent comprehensive asset condition survey
IV.	a 'survey on expiry' with technical advisers in ensuring that the assets are returned in the requisite condition.

2.5	It is anticipated that project leadership/PFI Contractual expiry advice will be required in relation to all matters relating to the Telereal Trillium PFI contract.
Attachments: Specification PS 21 115 PFI Contract Expiry Advice V1.0 - redacted.pdf Incendium Alcatel 2 Successful Award Letter (Framework).pdf

Title: 265.4 (Lot 4 of The Deal 2030 Care and Support Ethical Framework) - Extra Care
Description:
Extra Care provides support to enable people to live as independently as possible, including help with day to day living, through direct support, assistive technology equipment and adaptations that can help to make life easier, maintain independence and health and wellbeing.

This wellbeing model builds on the assets of residents and people in the local community to create a home for life for residents, providing care in line with the principles of "just enough support" to enable them to live the best lives they can, deferring or avoiding the need for hospital admissions or a move to more traditional residential care settings.  

Caring and compassionate support is provided by local ethical care providers who are passionate and dedicated to working in an asset-based way ensuring individuals live the life they choose and can fulfil their aims and ambitions.  

We want to work with providers who are experts at proactively maximising community connections; developing relationships; ensuring access to leisure and culture; promoting good health and wellbeing; supporting individuals into volunteering opportunities; and developing people's confidence and independence.

To achieve a transformed model of Extra Care the successful provider will be required to work holistically with individuals to ensure just enough support which is personalised, flexible and responsive.  

The service(s) will be delivered from one or more of seven Schemes within the Borough.

Title: New Horizons Specialist Supplier Tender
Description:
We are seeking a suitably qualified organisation or individual to help support the specific target group of Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic (BAME) participants.  We are seeking to engage and accelerate project engagement, support service development and delivery to achieve greater impact for this specific participant group within the New Horizons (NH) Project. We are seeking suppliers that can draw upon local, national, and international best practice in the field to embed an evidence-based model that reflects and addresses the challenges faced by participants due to the COVID-19 pandemic in accessing, sustaining employment and training opportunities. Therefore, we are seeking to procure a supplier that can offer an evidenced based approach which will ensure good quality support to participants and include innovative solutions to the challenges presented by Covid 19 in reaching and supporting this participant group in LCR. We are seeking to work with a supplier that can demonstrate a deep understand of the barriers and propose a working model that is holistic, value based and offer sustainable long-term solutions for this target audience. The provider will be able to propose the development of innovative engagement methodologies to ensure that equality of opportunity is achieved within the programme. The successful supplier will be able to conduct robust programme eligibility processes and propose an individual needs assessment process to ensure that participants are eligible and will also benefit fully from the programme. The successful supplier will detail how they will develop a bespoke set support to improve confidence skills, job search, and achieve progress toward employment.  The tender response should also highlight how any proposed model approach encompass elements such as basic skills, personalised and bespoke "back to work" programme of education, training and volunteering opportunities.  Suppliers should also detail how they could contribute  to project research, production and dissemination of policy papers and reports to local and national Government and agencies, Combined Authorities and LEP's. 

The value of the contract will be up to £50,000 in total. 

To apply please complete and submit the Tender Brief and Response Document and the Budget document to info@thewo.org.uk by 12pm 17th January 2022.
Attachments: 6. New Horizons Specialist Supplier Tender Brief and Response Document V1.docx NH Specialist Tender Budget Template.xlsx

Title: Homes England Strategic Growth Team - Horizon Scanning: Future Opportunities Commission
Description:
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/homes-england-contracts-and-tenders\r
\r
Purpose and Objectives of the this study\r
\r
Given changing political priorities and policy towards regeneration and levelling up, there is a need identify opportunity growth areas throughout England and to diversify the thematic and geographical scope of our Strategic Growth team's work. \r
 \r
The purpose of this study is to therefore identify, develop and assess a long list of broad geographically focused opportunity areas that have placemaking prospects, economic growth, social bene-fit and environmental enhancement that without strategic intervention risks not being delivered. Given the early stage remit of the Strategic Development & Infrastructure Team, we are interested in looking at opportunities beyond the Local Plan stage, to influence future policy direction.

Title: LEP Provision of a Proof of Concept Study for the Development of the North East Life Science Manufacturing and Innovation Zone
Description:
This proof-of-concept study will explore how the development of a North East Life Science Manufacturing and Innovation Zone can support the achievement of the North East Health & Life Science Strategy 2030 vision and goals.

It's anticipated that the LSMIZ will support the achievement of the strategic vision and goals through: 
•	Identifying and bringing forward a pipeline of existing and new projects through the LSMIZ development process. 
•	Support investment into individual projects through strengthening and de-risking investment propositions through integration with the LSMIZ. 
•	Leveraging new investment into the region through amplifying and growing awareness of regional assets and developments through the promotion of the LSMIZ. 
•	Increase the number of inward investment enquiries through providing external stakeholders visibility of development sites and projects that seek investment. 
Attracting increased investment from Government through providing departments such as, Office of Life Science and UKRI visibility of how investment in key LSMIZ developments/projects can enhance the UK's sectoral competitiveness.    
Whilst the Buyer in the Contact Details is listed as "North Tyneside Council", this entry is system generated. For the avoidance of doubt, the Buyer in this case is the North East LEP ). North Tyneside Council are conducting this procurement on NE LEP's behalf

Title: Developing a communications and knowledge exchange plan for the MMO's Evidence and Evaluation (E&E) team
Description:
The aim of this project is to generate significant outcomes and positive impact by strengthening communication of, and engagement with, the knowledge from evidence and evaluation work collated and coordinated by the MMO E&E team.
There is a need to explore how knowledge exchange and engagement from and with the E&E team could be improved, primarily to help deliver the Evidence Strategy 2021-2025 goal of 'Wider and Faster Utilisation of Evidence Products', but also to underpin the aim of the MMO to be an evidence-led organisation. The work described here is to deliver an E&E Team Knowledge Exchange and engagement plan, to support initial delivery of the plan, and provide recommendations for the MMO Communications and E&E teams.

Title: CEFAS21-139 OCPP ALDFG outreach campaign in Sri Lanka
Description:
The OCPP was announced this year as a key bilateral aid programme under the £500m Blue Planet Fund. Under the OCPP, Cefas will use existing experience of collaboration at an international level, to develop innovative science techniques and analyses with OCPP partner countries that address marine pollution challenges.

Cefas requires the successful Tenderer to organise an outreach campaign in Sri Lanka to raise awareness on the effect of ALDFG and mismanagement of end of life (EOL) fishing gear on the marine environment. The events should be face-to-face seminar, talks or workshops that should target coastal communities relying on fisheries or stakeholders (harbours, vessel crews) related to the fishery industry. The number of different targeted communities/stakeholders should not be less than five and the number of individuals involves not lower than 50. Outreach material (presentations, brochures) are required to be prepared in English, Tamil and Sinhala and will be used during the events. Cefas will provide some initial outreach material that can be used during the events or can be used to produce new material. Where possible and appropriate, these materials (e.g. slides) will be adapted to the target audience. The events should be planned with the aim to cover as many different communities around Sri Lanka as possible. Before starting the events, the materials will have to be cleared by Cefas. In case limitations due to the COVID pandemic will prevent the Tenderer from carrying out the events, a plan B should be conceptualised based on distribution of material (posters, brochures) to target communities, or remote events (online events).
Attachments: CEFAS21-139 Contract for OCPP ALDFG outreach campaign in Sri Lanka_SIGNED 25.01.22_Redacted.pdf

Title: Superimposed Road Markings Specialist Surfacing and Studs - AWARD
Description:
Title: Superimposed Road Markings Specialist Surfacing and Studs
      Ref: SMBC 21051
      
      Description: Sandwell Metropolitan Borough Council, Dudley Metropolitan Borough Council and Wolverhampton City Council have identified a requirement to identify and appoint a suitably qualified and experienced Supplier for the Superimposed Road Markings, Specialist Surfacing (High friction) and Studs within the Borough of Sandwell, Dudley and Wolverhampton City Council which are situated in the West Midlands.
      
      The Framework Agreement ("Contract") will be to maintain Superimposed Road Markings, Specialist Surfacing (High friction) and Studs on its highways network. The works information in the Specification sets out the performance requirements for the supplying and laying thermoplastic road paint incorporating solid glass beads.
      
      Value of Contract
      The estimated annual value of this contract is broken down as follows: -
      Sandwell Metropolitan Borough Council £200,000
      Dudley Metropolitan Borough Council £170,000
      Wolverhampton City Council Unknown
      
      These figures are intended to be used as a guide only and are not a guarantee of the level of business that will be generated from this contract.
      The contract is primarily for use by the borough councils of Sandwell, Dudley and Wolverhampton City Council.

Title: Tender for a New eCommerce System for Hampshire County Council's County Supplies Business - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for the supply of Procurement for a replacement eCommerce platform for County Supplies. The aim is to update and replace the existing website to provide a secure eCommerce service with a focus on customer journey and quality service delivery. Integration with SAP is also required.
      
      The Tender will commence on 15th September 2021 and will be for a period of 5 years.
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the Selection Questionnaire together with supporting information by 14:00hrs on Friday 7th May 2021.  
      
      The Selection Questionnaire can be obtained when logged into In-Tend by selecting 'View Details' on the relevant tender advert and clicking the 'Express Interest' tab. Once in the tender there are five tabs - 'Tender',  Selection Questionnaire (Stage one), 'Correspondence', 'Clarifications' & 'History'. Select the 2nd tab Selection Questionnaire (stage one) where you will find useful information under 'Tender Details' continue to scroll down to the heading 'Tender Documents Received' where you will be able to view / download the documents.
      
      In addition, guidance on how to participate in a tender, download & upload documents/returns and if required, register your company (free of charge), can be found on the In-Tend site under the 'Help' or 'Information for Suppliers' buttons.
      
      Kind Regards,
      Russell Cook

Title: CEFAS21-118 OCPP fisheries and ghost gear data collection in Sri Lanka
Description:
The OCPP was announced this year as a key bilateral aid programme under the £500m Blue Planet Fund. Under the OCPP, Cefas will use existing experience of collaboration at an international level, to develop innovative science techniques and analyses with OCPP partner countries that address marine pollution challenges.

Cefas requires the successful Tenderer to organise a 'physical/in person' data collection campaign to collect data on ALDFG and end of life (EOL) fishing gear in Sri Lanka. Data shall be collected through a technical questionnaire prepared by Cefas scientists. The questionnaire is aimed at fishery vessel owners, fishers, crewmembers, port operators and any other relevant stakeholders related to fisheries in Sri Lanka. Cefas will share the questionnaire with the successful Tenderer before discussing  possible final adjustments. Once the questionnaire is finalised, the successful Tenderer will identify a representative number of people to interview, aiming to cover as many different communities around Sri Lanka as possible. Before starting the interviews, a training session will be organised by Cefas to train the operators to collect data as consistently as possible throughout the campaign.

The successful Tenderer is required to be able to translate the questionnaire from English into Sinhala and Tamil and be able to perform the interviews using operators that are fluent in Sinhala and Tamil  in order to maximise reach and ensure accuracy of the answers.

After the collection of the data, the successful tenderer will produce a report doing a preliminary analysis of the data and will hand over all the data and metadata to Cefas.
Attachments: CEFAS21-118 Contract for OCPP ALDFG data collection in Sri Lanka_Signed_19.01.22_Redacted.pdf
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Evolved Research and Consulting Ltd|Rose Cottage, Lymington, Hampshire, SO41 6BE, UNITED KINGDOM|NONE_OTHER||No|No]

Title: Provision of '30by30: best practice for conservation'
Description:
The primary aim of this project is to provide insight into, and communicate, best practice for delivering conservation measures including Protected Areas and Other Effective Areabased Conservation Measures in support of achieving 30x30.
Focusing on practical, cost-effective and highly impactful interventions and approaches. - Ensuring that Parties to the CBD are aware of best practices in support of 30x30 policies and their implementation.
Anticipated outcomes of the project include:
-	Robust evidence-based drawing on a wide range of existing sources such as research literature, empirical studies and case studies on conservation measures and their effective application. 
-	Innovative research outcomes through building on information provided in the DEFRA-funded 30x30 evidence reviews on what makes area-based conservation measures effective. 
-	Influential, evidence-based narrative on protecting biodiversity through a synthesise and present robust evidence including some case studies and existing guidelines for effective conservation, as the basis for providing cost-effective best practice measures. 
-	Resourceful funding solutions in identifying which cost-effective actions would generate the greatest co-benefits for other targets across the post-2020 framework.
-	Accessible knowledge base on conservation through clearly communicating findings in an engaging and impactful manner, using innovative communication methods such as infographics.
Additional Text: Please note that Defra procurement uses e-tendering, provided by Bravosolutions. In order to access the Bravo system you will need to be registered. Could I therefore request that you register on the Bravo portal for Defra. If you're already registered on the Bravo portal please check that your registration includes Defra, as you have to specify us in order to correctly receive the tender documents. If you have any problems with the registration process, please contact the Bravo helpline on 0800 368 4850 or alternatively email them at help@bravosolution.co.uk. The link you require for new registration/amendments to registrations is - https://defra.bravosolution.co.uk

Title: The Swale - Shellfish Quality Monitoring, A784
Description:
Swale Borough Council is inviting Expressions of Interest to quote for shellfish quality monitoring of The Swale

The contract will involve the service provider collecting samples of shellfish according to an agreed sampling plan, always complying with the current Food Standards Agency (FSA) and The Centre for Environment, Fisheries and Aquaculture Science (CEFAS) protocols for microbiological quality, the presence of toxin-producing plankton in production waters and biotoxins and chemical contaminants in live bivalve molluscs.  In practical terms the service will involve taking the required amount of water and flesh samples of shellfish from classified beds in The Swale, storing and transporting shellfish to the Public Health England FWEM laboratory for analysis and all associated administration.  

The contract shall commence on 1 April 2022 and terminate on 31 March 2026. The council may extend the opportunity for a further 1 year. 

Expressions of Interest and the Request for Quotation (RFQ) document must be submitted / uploaded on the Council's e-tendering portal. The closing date for submission of Expressions of Interest and the closing date for the RFQ is 05/12/21 at 18:00hrs.

Title: CEFAS21-123 RFQ for Spectrofluorometer
Description:
The Analytical Chemistry laboratory at Cefas Lowestoft has a requirement for one (1) spectrofluorometer to support hydrocarbon analysis for a wide range of key government monitoring programmes. The system will be capable of simultaneously scanning excitation and emission wavelengths to produce synchronous fluorescence spectra. Cefas require:

-	1 x spectrofluorometer capable of synchronous scanning of excitation and emission wavelengths (Minimal scanning wavelength range 200 to 750 nm)
-	High-speed scanning
-	High sensitivity signal-to-noise ratio 1000 or above (RMS)
-	Long life Xenon lamp
-	Minimum of four cuvettes compatible with analysis of fluorescing hydrocarbons in organic solvent (pentane)
-	Auto-zero capability to subtract solvent response
-	Controller PC with operating software compatible with current MS Windows versions (MS Windows10/11)
-	Ability to save results as data files.

Delivery and Installation Requirements:

It is important to Cefas that delivery is made before or during WC 21st March 2022 to ensure payment by end of Financial Year 21-22. If delivery cannot be accommodated in this timeframe, Cefas reserve the right to withdraw from the exercise or request additional documentation to be provided as evidence of ownership.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Shimadzu UK Ltd.|Mill Court, Featherstone Road, Milton Keynes, Bedfordshire, MK12 5RD, UNITED KINGDOM|NONE_OTHER||No|No]

Title: CEFAS21-135 RFQ for Real-Time PCR System
Description:
The requirement is for a real-time q Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) system which will be used to detect presence (and relative quantity) of DNA of particular species within environmental DNA samples, using specific primer/probe combinations. Cefas typically use FAM as the fluorescent dye in the probe. Since the DNA is often present at low quantities, a high degree of sensitivity is required. Also important is the ability to run multiple samples simultaneously to increase sample throughput (hence the requirement for a 96-well machine).   

Requirement:

A real-time qPCR machine to include:
-	96-well capacity, in a 0.2 mL isothermal block
-	ability to run reaction volumes of 10 - 100 μL
-	compatibility with a range of fluorescent dyes, specifically including FAM and SYBR-Green dyes  
-	wi-fi connectivity  
-	design and analysis software, provided without need for further licence purchase, that supports analysis using a web browser or desktop computer 

Delivery and Installation Requirements:

It is important to Cefas that delivery is made before or during WC 21st March 2022 to ensure payment by end of FY. If delivery cannot be accommodated in this timeframe, Cefas reserve the right to withdraw from the exercise or request additional documentation to be provided as evidence of ownership.

The equipment is required to be delivered/installed to Cefas Lowestoft NR33 0HT.

All pricing provided must be inclusive of delivery 'INCOTERM DDP' if item is being imported (please advise).
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Cambridge Bioscience Ltd|Munro House, Trafalgar Way, Bar Hill, Cambridge, Cambridgeshire, CB23 8SQ, UNITED KINGDOM|NONE_OTHER||No|No]

Title: CEFAS21-133 RFQ for Microwave for Acid Digestions
Description:
Detailed Description
The Analytical Chemistry laboratory at Cefas Lowestoft has a requirement for one high pressure digestion microwave to support trace metals analysis for a wide range of key government monitoring programmes. The system will be capable of fully digesting sediment samples using strong acids (including hydrofluoric acid), and Biota samples, for the analysis of trace metals by ICP.

Requirement:

One (1) High pressure microwave system for inorganic and organic samples including temperature control sensors and control system.
One (1) full set of reaction vessels for acid digestion, vessel rack and turntable.

Cefas require the microwave system to consist of the following:

- A minimum of 1800 Watt dual magnetron
- Internally coated with fluoropolymer (or equivalent) and corrosion resistant exhaust system.
- Ability to save data immediately to create digestion report
- Minimum 40 place rotor with vent and reseal technology, capable of high pressure (minimum 35 bar) and high temperature (180°C or more) with vessel volume of >50ml.
- Full set of vessels and their ancillary parts.
- Fixed-vessel shield to allow for easy removal of vessels
- Temperature control and monitoring of vessels
- Safety features such as power cut off in event of over-pressurization, auto-vent etc.
- Control terminal that operates the microwave system. A statement with regards to costs of firmware/software updates throughout the lifetime of the equipment is required if applicable.
- Ability to print each run (T/P trace) or transfer this as a data file.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Anton Paar Ltd|Unit F, The Courtyard, Alban Park, Hatfield Road, St Albans AL4|NONE_OTHER||No|No]

Title: Weed Control Spraying 2022 - 2026
Description:
Tenders are invited for the application of herbicide to the Highways, footways and associated features in the borough of North Tyneside.

The Contract period: 36 Months Commencing 01 March 2022 (with an Option to Extend for a further 12 Month Period)

Below is an operational timetable:

1st Application (1 March - 30th April)
Glyphosate
Glufosinate Ammonium
Flazasulfuron around obstacles

2nd Application (1 May - 31 June)
Glyphosate
Glufosinate Ammonium
Flazasulfuron as required

3rd Application (1 July - 30 September)
Glyphosate
Glufosinate Ammonium
Flazasulfuron as required


Optional 4th Application - (1 October - 28th February)
Glyphosate
Glufosinate Ammonium
Flazasulfuron


The Service shall normally consist of three applications during the growing season, between March and September. The first application shall be carried out between March to April and completed within eight weeks of the Authority's instruction to commence the treatment. The second application shall be carried out between May and June and completed within eight weeks of the Authority's instruction to commence the treatment. The third application shall be carried out between July and September and completed within eight weeks of the Authority's instruction to commence the treatment.

Title: Independent Sexual Violence Advisor (ISVA) Service  - AWARD
Description:
The Independent Sexual Violence Advisor Service (ISVA) is a jointly funded service between the following partners: Office of the Police and Crime Commissioner(OPCC), Hampshire County Council (HCC), Portsmouth City Council (PCC) and Southampton City Council (SCC). OPCC is the designated lead partner.
      This Tender has been prepared by Hampshire County Council on behalf of the Office of the Police and Crime Commissioner, Southampton City Council and Portsmouth City Council collectively described in hereinafter referred to as the 'Authority'; for the purpose of inviting proposals from suitable providers (the 'Tenderers') for the provision of the services Document 5 Service Specification (the 'Services').
      Following evaluation of the compliant tenders, and approval of the outcome, Hampshire County Council intends to appoint a single supplier under a Contract to provide the Services.
      
      The Contract will commence on 1st April 2022 and will be for a period of three years with the option to extend for a further four years.
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 14.00 hrs on Wednesday 17th November 2021.
      
      How to obtain the Tender Documents
      The Tender documents can be accessed when logged into In-Tend by selecting 'Current' then 'View Details' on the relevant tender advert and clicking the 'Express Interest' tab. Once in the tender there are five tabs - 'Tender', 'ITT - documents', 'Correspondence', 'Clarifications' and 'History'. Select the 2nd tab (ITT - documents) where you will find useful information under 'Tender Details' continue to scroll down to the heading 'Tender Documents Received' where you will be able to view / download the documents.
      
      Please download all the documents and read very carefully.
      
      Opting In and Opting Out
      Please note you are required to 'Opt In' before you can access the 'My tender Return' to start populating your response. 
      
      PLEASE NOTE you are required to 'Opt In' to view & complete the two Questionnaires for this project. 
      
      The 'Opt Out' functionality will also be available throughout the duration of the tender process. Opting out will give you the option of declaring you no longer want to receive any further communication in relation to this tender along with the opportunity of providing comments and feedback for this decision.
      
      You can choose to 'Opt In' at any time during the tender process if you initially decided to 'Opt Out'.
      
      Your completed 'Tender Return Document(s)' should be submitted via 'In-tend' by 2pm on Wednesday 17th November 2021.
      
      Further Guidance
      In addition, guidance on how to participate in a tender - download and upload documents / returns and if required, register your company (free of charge), can be found on the In-tend site under the 'He...

Title: Occupational Health and Related Services
Description:
Buckinghamshire and Milton Keynes Fire Authority (BMKFA) (the Contracting Authority) wish to appoint a single Service Provider to provide the Occupational Health and Related Services, including Employee Assistance Programme.  The Contracting Authority's service delivery is managed through its Headquarters location, based at Aylesbury, Buckinghamshire, with 19 fire stations across the county.  The total numbers of staff for the Contracting Authority will vary during the contract period. The staff number of 478 is based on current needs and are indicative only. The volume of work may fluctuate in accordance with the needs of the organisation and under-utilisation in one area may be compensated by an increase in another.
The overall aims of the Occupational Health service is to promote occupational and general health to all employees of the Contracting Authority by: 
Promoting healthy working practices/lifestyles  
Providing routine medicals and management referrals 
Assessing and monitoring the effects of health on work, and work on health  
Preventing ill health arising from working practices or conditions 
Reducing sickness absence and ill-health retirements, including monitoring long-term and/or recurring sickness absence.  
Education/awareness of health and well being  
Rehabilitation  
Liaison with external specialists  
Undertaking pre - employment assessment /return to work assessments  
Random and pre-arranged substance misuse and alcohol testing 

The contract is due to be awarded by Jan 2022, mobilisation period up to 31 March 2022, with contract services commencing 01 April 2022 to 31 March 2025 with an option to extend up to 24 months to 31 March 2027.
Total Contract Value range £280k to £300k (for a possible 5 year period).
The Estimated Contract Value stated above is based on relevant economic factors including the budget available to the Contracting Authority, and wider market and category knowledge. Tender responses with a total price exceeding the Estimated Contract Value by more than 5% will be disqualified from the tender process. Bidders are reminded to carefully note this requirement of the Contracting Authority before any tender submissions. 

To access tender documents, bidders must register and Opt In to view documents via e-tendering portal via the following link:

https://in-tendhost.co.uk/bucksfire/aspx/Home
Additional Text:
Link to e-tendering portal to access tender documents

https://in-tendhost.co.uk/bucksfire/aspx/Home

Title: Senior Intervenors for Adults in Long Term Segregation - Phase II
Description:
The Authority required suppliers who can deliver senior consultancy support to resolve challenges and provide oversight to progress the discharge and community support arrangements for a small number of adults who are in long term segregation in mental health hospitals.

The primary objectives are to provide intensive case management for between 1 and 5 individual cases including:
·	To provide support, influence and challenge to senior service leaders (including commissioners and responsible clinicians) 
·	To ensure barriers are overcome for planning and managing the move out of hospital/LTS; and 
·	To support and ensure the needs of people with learning disabilities or autistic people can be met in the community where they have been assessed as ready for discharge (by their responsible clinician and/or multi-disciplinary team).

To achieve these suppliers will need to offer persistent overview, challenge and support to the system to enable progress. They will need to facilitate and influence, particularly at senior levels across organisations.
